Title: HC to supervise lake protection work
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Referring to a report in The Times of India that highlighted the plight of yet another Hyderabad lake, which is dying on account of official negligence, the bench of Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan and Justice A Abhishek Reddy sought an annual plan from the GHMC commissioner on how they will deal with dying lakes , mushrooming illegal structures, bad roads, and the deterioration of the once-glorious Musi river.

GHMC commissioner Lokesh Kumar told the bench that there are 185 lakes in Hyderabad and the civic body has brought in a lake protection force to protect them.

The bench sought to know from Lokesh as to why the GHMC is facing so many cases from the public.

“The pathetic condition of our lakes, roads, garbage disposal, illegal structures will bring a bad name to our city,” the CJ said.

“Explain how you are planning to revive these lakes, and we will supervise all the works on a regular basis.”

Title: Karnataka: Decomposed body found inside abandoned car
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

BENGALURU: The decomposed body of an unidentified man was found in an abandoned car near a garage in Nelamangala , Bengaluru Rural, on Monday morning.

Residents alerted police following foul smell emanating from the car parked near Kunigal Circle. On opening the door, cops found the body on the back seat. The abandoned car was in a running condition.

Examination of CCTV footage from nearby buildings showed a man entering the car on the night of January 23. Since then, he hadn’t come out, police said.

“It looks like he died the same night. Since there are no signs of struggle or fight, we don’t suspect it to be a murder. The body is decomposed beyond recognition and we have sent viscera samples to the forensic science laboratory to learn the cause of death,” a police officer said. Locals suspect he could be a vagabond, taking shelter in the abandoned vehicle.

Title: Dehradun celebrates Republic Day with zeal & fervour
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: A host of events and celebrations marked the 71st Republic Day in the city on Sunday.

The main event was held at the Parade Ground which was attended by CM Trivendra Singh Rawat and governor Baby Rani Maurya. The CM felicitated families of five freedom fighters and seven state police officials. From expansion of educational institutions to ongoing projects to widen roads and build new ones that connect 250 villages with highways, the CM elaborated on the achievements of his nearly three-year-old government. “We’ll complete work on Dobra-Chanthi bridge by 2020. We’ve already received Rs 18,000 crore investments within a year of the investors’ meet,” he said, adding the state has become a major destination for weddings and film shoots.

Celebrations were also held in all the other districts.

Title: Tyre exports rise 11% in April-Nov
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Chennai: Tyre exports, between April and November were up 11% y-o-y by volume, a shade lower than the 12% y-o-y increase in export volume previously.

Tyre companies exported 77,70,439 units in the April-November period, up from 70,14,231 units in the year-ago period. This despite production dropping by 6% to 1,213 lakh units from 1,294 lakh units in the year-ago period as vehicle companies cut back production drastically, data from Association of Tyre Manufacturers Association (ATMA) said.

Tyre exports hit double-digit growth in FY16-17 when it increased by 16%. But the very next year, export growth was down to 6%, followed by a 0.2% fall in FY18-19. The rise in exports this year comes after two years of sluggish shipments. With tyre product mix reflecting global trends, exports are expected to increase further, said Satish Sharma, president-Asia Pacific, Middle East, Africa, Apollo Tyres.

What has also helped is that vehicle companies, both Indian and MNC, are “increasingly exporting out of India which is a production hub and tyre exports are riding on it. Also globally, ‘made in India’ has as good if not a better reputation than ‘made in China’,” added Sharma. Typically tyre companies export around 10%-15% of their production. Although tyre replacement demand is still buoyant, with domestic sales falling and OEs cutting production, overall tyre production has also taken a hit, said Sharma.

“In value terms OE is 30% while replacement is 70% but in many segments OE volumes are significant,” said Sharma.

The highest increase in exports has been in motorcycles (up 23%), followed by three-wheelers (up 20%). Passenger vehicles are up 10% and medium and heavy trucks and buses are up 12%, the data showed.

Title: Netaji’s grandson visits Subhas temple on R-Day, pays tributes
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Grandson of Subhas Chandra Bose Somnath Bose at the temple in Lamahi village

Varanasi: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose’s grandson Somnath Bose visited the newly inaugurated Subhash Temple in Lamahi on the occasion of Republic Day on Sunday. He also took part in Republic Day celebrations organised by the Vishal Bharat Sansthan.

After paying tributes to Netaji, Bose expressed his happiness over the establishment of the temple. “It is the first such temple in the world to connect the followers of Netaji across the world,” he said.

Bose had also visited Gorakhpur district jail recently and paid tributes to freedom fighter Pt Ram Prasad Bismil.

The Subhas Temple, constructed by the Vishal Bharat Sansthan, was inaugurated recently on the occasion of the 123rd birth anniversary of Bose on January 23. The 11-feet temple houses a life-size granite statue of Bose. The sole objective of the temple is to grow a sense of patriotism among the people and keep the memory of Netaji alive, said VBS founder Dr Rajiv Srivastava.

Title: HDFC posts record quarterly profit of Rs 8,372cr in Oct-Dec
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Mumbai: The country’s largest mortgage company HDFC on Monday reported its highest ever quarterly net profit of Rs 8,372 crore for October-December 2019 — nearly thrice the net profit of Rs 2,114 crore in the corresponding period in the previous year. The sharp increase in earnings was a result of changes in accounting after its erstwhile subsidiary Gruh finance merged with Bandhan Bank .

Following the merger on October 17, 2019, HDFC allotted 15.9 crore shares aggregating 9.9% of the total issued share capital of Bandhan Bank. “In accordance with para 22 of ‘Ind AS 28 – Investments in Associates and Joint Ventures’, On derecognition of the investment in Gruh, the corporation has recognised a fair value gain of Rs 9,020 crore,” HDFC said in a statement.

In a post-results call, Keki Mistry, VC and CEO, said this was the first time that loans in the bank’s books crossed Rs 5 lakh crore in an assets under management (AUM) basis. “The 14% increase in AUM were driven by a 16% increase in individual loans,” said Mistry. “The loan growth is largely happening in the affordable segment. This is reflected in the average loan size, which has been falling in every quarter — from Rs 27.7 lakh, to Rs 27.6 lakh to Rs 26.5 lakh. Taken together, the average loan size of this fiscal works out to Rs 26.9 lakh.”

The corporation has used a large chunk of the exceptional gains during the quarter to make provisions. As against the mandated provision of Rs 3,624 crore, HDFC made a provision of Rs 9,934 crore or 2.25% of total loans.

The profit-before-tax for the nine months ended December 31, 2019 stood at Rs 17,658 crore compared to Rs 9,428 crore in the corresponding period of the previous year. In the same nine months, 36% of home loans approved in volume terms and 18% in value terms have been to customers from the economically weaker section (EWS) and low income groups (LIG).

The corporation on an average, has been approving 9,400 loans monthly to the EWS and LIG segment, with monthly such average approvals at Rs 1,500 crore. The average home loan to the EWS and LIG segment stood at Rs 10.2 lakh and Rs 17.6 lakh respectively.

Title: Bihar: Anti-CAA resolutions unlawful, says Speaker
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Vijay Kumar Chaudhary

BIHARSHARIF: State assembly Speaker Vijay Kumar Chaudhary on Monday described resolutions passed by different state assemblies against the implementation of Citizenship (Amendment) Act ( CAA ) as “unlawful” as the Constitution does not provide any scope for it.

Addressing media persons at Sheikhpura circuit house, Chaudhary said states were constitutionally bound to implement any Act passed by the Parliament.

Kerala, Punjab, Rajasthan and West Bengal assemblies have so far passed resolutions against CAA.

Lauding ‘Jal Jeevan Haryali’ campaign of the state government, Chaudhary said, “Pollution can be controlled only through conservation of groundwater and environment. The entire world should emulate this campaign of the state government aimed at reducing pollution.”

Title: Children with special needs to get ‘sensory park’ in New Town
Content: KOLKATA: The Housing Infrastructure Development Corporation (Hidco) has started work to set up a sensory park in New Town, the first of its kind in the city, designed to cater to children with special needs and differently abled persons. The park will be set up on a 2.5-acre plot in Action Area-II near Owl More. Officials said the design was decided through an architects’ competition. Work commenced last week and the completion target has been set at 18 months.“The park will be set up keeping in mind the smart city concept, in which everyone, including special children and people with disabilities, has equal opportunities,” said an official.According to plans, the park will have various activities and play zones designed for children with special needs, including games for children with impaired vision where they will be able to play with help of Braille. There will be a water arena, a sandpit and a fossil-dig area as well.There will also be a wheelchair-friendly swing and see-saw. “The park will allow children with special needs to spend quality time in an open green space,” an official said.Parents of children with special needs have welcomed the initiative.“Special children do not get proper space in general parks and they cannot mix freely with other children. We, as parents, always worry about how they will react in such situations. A free space for children with special needs will be of immense help,” said Abhijit Dasgupta, a father of one such child.“Special children need sensory and motor units to properly express themselves. It is a great initiative taken by the authorities,” said ENT specialist Ranajit Mandal, a father of one such kid, who, along with a group of like-minded people have set up a residential campus for special children and their parents near Barasat.

Title: Sensex tanks 458 pts on epidemic fears
Content: Mumbai: Dalal Street turned cautious over the rapid spread of coronavirus from China and closed 458 points lower on Monday that followed other global markets.With rising fears of an economic cost of the spread of the epidemic in China and the global economy, investors around the world preferred ‘risk-off’ trades, meaning turning away from risky assets like equities and derivatives, reports said. Reflecting the global mood, during the day foreign funds in India net sold stocks worth Rs 439 crore, BSE data showed.In Monday’s market, the sensex opened about 100 points lower and lost ground through the session to close at 41,155, down 1.1% on the day. Metal stocks lost the most as traders fear China, under the current situation, will import lesser amount of metals, while pharma stocks closed with gains on hopes that a viral epidemic may lead to increased demand for medicines, market players said. The Nifty too lost 1.1%, or 129 points, to close at 12,119.According to Siddhartha Khemka, head (retail research), Motilal Oswal Financial Services, market sentiment was hit by rising concerns over fast-spreading coronavirus, as it might lead to slowdown in the global economy. “Investors were also cautious ahead of the Budget which is at the end of this week,” he said.Market players are expecting trading to be volatile this week. Several of the heavyweights are announcing their quarterly numbers this week. Also, the futures & options contracts for the month will expire on Thursday and then there’s a meeting of the US Federal Reserve. The week will end with the Budget on Saturday. The exchanges have made special arrangements to keep the market open on Saturday, when it is usually closed for trading.On Monday, the global markets also saw a coronavirus scare-driven selling with Nikkei in Japan closing 2%, while Hang Seng closed flat, FTSE was down nearly 2.5% in late trades and Dow Jones and S&P 500 were both down 1.5% each in early trades.

Title: Duo gets death for rape, murder of Class VI girl
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Chinsurah: A Hooghly court on Monday sentenced two persons to death for the abduction, rape, murder, mutilation and burial of a Class VI girl in Balagarh on December 12, 2014. A third accused, who was 17-years-old then, is being tried before a juvenile court in Hooghly. On Saturday, the Hooghly sessions court had convicted Gourab Mondal and Kaushik Malik for the crime. The same court handed down the death penalty on Monday.

The victim was heading for tuition from her home in Uttar Gopalnagarh village on December 12, 2014, when she was abducted by the duo and the teen, all from Hattala village. When she didn’t return home by 7.30pm, her parents Chinmoy, a flower farmer, and Pranati Mondal looked for her all night and filed a missing diary the next day.

A day later, the abductors called Mondal and demanded Rs 3 lakh as ransom. However, Mondal told them he could not arrange so much money.Police tracked the trio with the location the call was made from and arrested them.

During interrogation, the trio confessed they abducted and raped the girl. On not getting the ransom, they killed her and chopped off the legs. They confessed to burying the body on the banks of the Ganga in the Jirat area. Police took the trio to the spot and exhumed the body.

The two adult accused were charged with abduction, rape and murder, among other offences. Their teenaged accomplice — who was similarly charged — was sent to a juvenile court that remanded him in a government home.

After Monday’s sentencing, Mondal said, “Though we will never get our daughter back, this judgment has brought us some solace.”

Title: Accused in Maha arms haul was nabbed thrice in Bengal
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Kolkata/Mumbai: A 34-year-old man from Usthi in South 24 Parganas was nabbed by the Kolkata Police STF and Maharashtra ATS on January 20 for allegedly being a part of the right-wing outfit that was involved in the Nallasopara alleged arms haul case. Pratap Hazra, a resident of Hazrapara, has also been accused of being part of the conspiracy to carry out an attack at a music event, Sunburn 2017, in Pune.

“Hazra was wanted under the Unlawful Activity (Prevention) Act. We got a tip from ATS, which stated he had been on the run from 2018 and that he was the 13th accused who specialized in crude bombs and explosives. We picked him up from Usthi through our network,” an officer said. According to cops, he was arrested at least thrice for disturbing communal harmony by the Diamond Harbour police.

Hazra has been sent to police custody till January 30, but his Bengal exploits have left STF worried. The ATS has already alerted STF about another Bengal operative, a close aide of Hazra who remains elusive. The Kolkata Police STF said work on this front has begun with Bengal STF.

An officer in the team led by additional DG (ATS) Deven Bharti said Hazra had developed ties with the Govansh Raksha Samiti and later, the Bhavani Sena.

“Our investigation revealed that Hazra had trained other members of the group on the preparation of country-made bombs,” he told TOI.

“Hazra was on the run ever since other members of this group began to be picked up one by one since 2018. Since some members were also allegedly involved in the murders of rationalists Narendra Dabholkar and Gauri Lankesh, we will be investigating if Hazra had any role in those crimes. We arrested Hazra on January 20,” the ATS officer said.

In August 2018, the ATS had arrested three men — Sharad Kalaskar, Sudhanva Gondhalekar and Hindu Govansh Raksha Samiti member Vaibhav Raut — for possessing firearms and planning disruptive activities. Later, cops claimed the accused had conspired to orchestrate terror activities in Maharashtra, including Mumbai.

“When cops searched a property of Raut in Nallasopara, they found eight crude bombs in the house and 12 crude bombs in his shop. The seized material include gelatin sticks and chits containing literature on how to prepare bombs,” said an ATS officer. The agency had arrested 12 persons in the case and had filed a charge sheet in December 2018.

(With inputs from Mumbai bureau)

Title: JITO Angel Network invests $2,25,000 in aagey.com, Aadar
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Chennai: JITO Angel Network (JAN) has invested $2,25,000 in online financial solutions provider aagey.com and ayurveda brand Aadar .

“We are investing around Rs 1.3 crore in aagey.com and the rest in Aadar. Our total funding to start ups has touched Rs 40 crore up till now out of which Rs 25 crore investments happened in the last one year and we are targeting an additional Rs 60 crore investments by March 2021,” said Siddharth Munoth, VC, JITO Angel Network, JIIF (JITO Incubation & Innovation Foundation).

aagey.com is a one stop destination for finance related needs of small enterprises and the investment will help the company make technological upgrades and expand its operations.

The latest funding round for aagey.com was closed with Ketan Kothari of Arvog.com emerging as the lead Investor. Other investors include Girish Jain from KJMC Financial Services, Sunil Singhvi from South Handlooms, Vinay Jain from MLM India and a few others.

aagey.com has been founded by Akaash Shankar, CEO; Deepak Mishra, head analytics, Lovina Monis, business head and Abhishek Purohit, director IT.

A Mumbai-based Ayurveda health and fitness start-up Aadar has been founded by IIT-B alumnus Aadil Shah, who had earlier started Manch, an ed-tech venture that was sold to Toppr in 2016.

He was soon joined with fellow IIT-B alumnus and ex-investment banker Pratul Mangal.

The seed round in Aadar featured, apart from JAN, Sprout venture partners and Lets Venture. The start-up also counts Syed Safawi (ex-CEO VLCC Healthcare) amongst its early stage investors.

Title: 3 of family injured in LPG cylinder explosion
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Pune: Three members of a family, including a six-month-old girl, suffered burn injuries following an LPG cylinder blast in their Kharadi house on Monday morning.

Fire brigade officials said Swarali Shankar Bhowale, her father, Shankar (28), and mother, Asha (22), stayed in a small rented house in the Sambhajinagar area of Kharadi.

After waking up on Monday morning, Asha was about to ignite the gas stove when the cylinder exploded. The officials said the flames soon spread in the room. Fire station officer Subhas Jadhav and his team reached the Bhowales’ place after receiving an emergency call at 8am.

“The granite platform in the kitchen was broken and the tin roof of the house went up in the air. Their clothes, bedding and other articles were gutted. The walls of two adjoining houses developed cracks in the explosion,” an officer said.

“The LPG cylinder leaked sometime the night before the accident. Bhowale had secured the LPG connection and the gas stove and cylinder were delivered to them two days ago,” the officer said. Swarali, Shankar and Asha were shifted to the Sassoon General Hospital.

On Sunday afternoon, a distribution point of Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company caught fire and a couple of shops were partially damaged at Dattanagar Chowk off the Katraj-Dehu road bypass. No casualty was reported.

Title: Sebi rejigs margin rules for commodities
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Mumbai: Markets regulator Sebi on Monday allowed differentiated margining systems for trading in derivatives of several commodities, by grading them according to inherent risks. It also said during the period considered off season for an agro commodity, an exchange could hike the margins for that commodity, mainly to rein in price volatility.

It also said that commodity exchanges (commexes) should categorise all tradeable commodities into three categories — low, medium and high — based on their price fluctuations in three years, and apply margins accordingly.It also said that the commex that records the highest turnover across all derivatives contracts for a particular commodity for the previous six months should be categorized as the lead exchange. The margin for that particular commodity should be set by the lead bourse and other bourses will follow the same margin system.

Market players said that given the very nature of commodities trading, a specilaised margining system was needed. “Recent incidents of risk management especially in Agri derivatives made it apparent that the risk management tools of securities markets can’t be superimposed on commodity derivatives market in totality, and hence it requires some modifications. This circular is a step in that direction wherein the challenges of risk emerging from the underlying commodities market have been addressed,” said Sanjit Prasad, MD, ICEX.

Title: Bihar: Energy dept employees, engineers protest over privatization rumour
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Patna police resorted to lathi charge on Bihar energy department employees at Vidyut Bhawan Baily road in Patn... Read More

PATNA: Police on Monday resorted to lathicharge and used water cannons on energy department employees protesting near Income Tax roundabout over “strong rumour” that the state government was privatizing Bihar State Power Holding Company Limited (BSPHCL) and its subsidiary companies.

Around 300 workers and engineers of power holding companies from various districts had gathered near Vidyut Bhawan under the banner of Vidyut Kamgar Padhadhikari Abhiyanta Sanyukt Sangharsh Morcha. They disrupted traffic on Bailey Road and Beerchand Patel Path and threatened to go on strike if the department decided to privatize BSPHCL and its subsidiaries.

Surendra Kumar, general secretary of Power Engineering Service Association, told this newspaper that they had written a letter to BSPHCL chief managing director (CMD) Pratyaya Amrit to make things clear on the issue. “We asked him to give clear answers about the issue as PM Narendra Modi has already said about privatization of power companies under Aditya Yojana. However, when there was no reply from the CMD, we gathered here to talk to him. But he refused to meet us. We will continue our protest,” he said.

A junior engineer from Gaya said police chased them like criminals and many of the employees were injured. “We are fighting for our rights. If the state government privatizes power holding company, we will lose our jobs,” he said.

Another employee of the power company said all staff recruited after 2012 will lose their jobs in case of privatization.

Pratyaya, when contacted, told this newspaper that a rumour had been spread among the engineers and employees of the power company that privatization had already been done. “We are inquiring about those who spread the rumour and how. I addressed the employees from across the state on last Monday, Saturday and even today through videoconferencing and assured them not to worry,” he said.

He added: “In November 2018, we had sent a letter to the Centre about our comments on proposed reforms and our experience with private players. It was horrendous. Then we terminated the franchise in Gaya, Muzaffarpur and Bhagalpur,” he clarified.

Title: Students upset with police handling of JNU and AMU incidents, says Nalsar VC
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Nalsar vice chancellor Faizan Mustafa garlanding the statue of IPS officer KS Vyas' statue at RBVRR TS Police ... Read More

HYDERABAD: Nalsar University of Law vice-chancellor Faizan Mustafa said students and academicians were particularly upset with the way police had handled the incidents in JNU and Aligarh Muslim University . He also said perception about police force is bad in the country and urged governments to spend more on police force.

Mustafa said students were unhappy about the disproportionate use of force at JNU, Delhi and AMU , Aligarh. “Delhi police, I believe, have done disservice to their reputation by their actions in JNU and the slow progress of investigation about the armed attack on some students,” Mustafa said.

“Since people have started reading the preamble of Constitution recently, it will be good for society if lower-rung officials also start understanding the fundamentals of Constitution,” he said while delivering the KS Vyas Memorial Lecture at the Telagana State Police Academy (TSPA) here on Monday.

A senior professor and jurist of constitutional law, Mustafa said governments should allocate more funds to strengthen the police force and also fill vacancies in the police department. All the states in India put together allot just 3% of their total budget for the police department. Among the states, Manipur allots the highest budget (8.7%) for cops.

Telangana’s budget allotment for cops is 1.9%, while neighbouring AP spends 2.1%.

“There are 20% vacancies in the police force. As against the UN recommended 222 cops per one lakh population, we have only 137 cops per one lakh population,” Mustafa pointed out.

The VC also talked about how people were increasingly swayed by the rule of law. “We are increasingly going in the direction of rule by law. You can pass any law which may be an unjust law or arbitrary law, a law which may be negation of fundamental principles of the Constitution and then you are governed by that law. As a teacher, it is a bad time to talk to a police officer,” he observed.

Mustafa said that NALSAR is signing an MoU with TSPA to provide degrees, diploma and certificate courses in law to police officials. The VC also advised trainee SIs to follow principles of Constitution.

Remembering IPS officer Vyas who lost his life in a Maoist attack, Telangana DGP M Mahendar Reddy said Vyas continues to inspire them. “If we have been able to curb Maoist activities , it is because of his contribution,” the DGP said.

Title: Former sarpanch critical after clash over gauchar land
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

PALANPUR: At least three persons including former and current sarpnach of Sherwada village in Kankrej taluka of Banaskatha were injured following clash over encroachment of gauchar land on Monday.

According to police, former sarpanch and former taluka panchyat president Hargovind Shervadiya was attacked with an axe by current sarpanch Karsan Joshi. Shervadiya’s condtion was critical and has been referred to Ahmedabad civil hospital after initial treatment at Dharpur Medical College in Patan.

Johi, who is a contractor by profession, suffered with minor injuries and was admitted to a referral hospital in Thara, said sub-inspector of Thara police station H N Patel.

Police said that Joshi had been accused by Shervadiya of encroaching upon gauchar land of the village. Shervadiya had also filed a complaints with the taluka and district panchayat a month ago. On Friday last, a team of panchyat officials had surveyed and since then tension has been building between supporters of Joshi and Shervadiya.

Police said a formal complaint was being registered and they were waiting to record statement of Shervadiya.

Title: Government puts 100% of Air India on sale, will absorb 2/3rd of liabilities
Content:
Representative image

‘AI’s land & building are not part of selloff’

NEW DELHI: The Centre on Monday offered to exit Air India and Air India Express by selling its entire stake, instead of the 76% it had offered two years ago, apart from the 50% it owns in ground-handling joint venture AI-SATS. It targets to complete the disinvestment process in the next five to six months.Learning from its 2018 experience, the government has eased eligibility norms for bidders too, and they will be expected to take on Rs 32,447 crore of debt-cum-liabilities — essentially current value of 146 aircraft they will be getting — of the total amount of Rs 88,781 crore with the government keeping with it Rs 56,334 crore.Unlike last time, there is no Jet Airways around (it shut down last April), making AI an attractive proposition. It is the only Indian carrier with medium- and long-haul wide-body aircraft, crew, flying rights and slots at airports across North America, Europe, Australia, Far East and Africa. With this USP, the Centre on Monday issued the preliminary information memorandum for AI’s strategic divestment where bidders, whether individual firms or consortia with a minimum net worth of Rs 3,500 crore — down from Rs 5,000 crore last time — can submit their bids for the airline by March 17.Indian carriers with negative net worth, which includes most of them except IndiGo , can also bid if they have a JV partner with whom they meet the minimum criteria. Qualified bidders will be announced on March 31. If all goes well, by July or August, the airline may have a new owner, who will need to retain the brand name AI.While the AI has a debt of over Rs 60,000 crore, bidders will be expected to take Rs 23,286.5 crore, which the written down value of AI and AI Express aircraft. Since the government has decided net assets will be equal to net liabilities for bidders, the latter will need to take over Rs 8,771.5 crore as of March 31, 2019. This exact figure will be decided on the date of the transaction though the total burden is expected to be about Rs 32,447 crore.The government will take over the remaining Rs 56,334 crore of debt and liabilities and transfer them to a specially-created special purpose vehicle AI Assets Holdings Ltd. This SPV will get AI’s non-core assets like land, building and artwork worth Rs 17,000 crore, which it will sell off and reduce the debt burden. The state will similarly devise ways to dilute the over Rs 39,000-crore debt with the SPV.Describing AI as a “great asset” with a young fleet of planes, especially widebody aircraft that fly across the globe, aviation minister H S Puri said: “Despite infusing Rs 30,500 crore in the AI since 2012, the airline has been running into losses year after year. Due to its accumulated debt of about Rs 60,000 crore, its financial position is very fragile. AI is in a debt trap that can be turned around by privatising it and we have learnt lessons from the 2018 bid. Lots of people have directly come to us and there is tremendous interest in AI (among potential buyers).”Puri termed the changed terms of sale regarding 100% stake sale; freezing AI debt for bidder at Rs 23,286.5 crore and current liabilities at Rs 8,771.5 crore (as on March 31, 2019) as “decisive parameters”. “AI’s land and building are not part of this sale. The successful bidder will be allowed to use Delhi corporate office for a limited period.”

Title: Experts seek delineation of Jayakwadi, upstream dams
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Aurangabad: With the Marathwada region again staring at an water crisis, experts have called for paying attention to the long-pending demand for delineating the Jayakwadi major irrigation project and a few other important dams in the region.

They have also sought for delineation of the upstream reservoirs in Ahmednagar and Nashik districts.

The Maharashtra Management of Irrigation Systems by Farmers Act, 2005, mandates delineation of the command area — an exercise believed to require crores of rupees.

Water rights activist Abhijit Dhanorkar said political parties should pay attention to the factors leading to water scarcity in Marathwada instead of making vague and populist demands.

“Despite being mandatory, the delineation process is pending for the past 15 years. The Bombay high court had directed officials to carry out the delineation process of the Jayakwadi dam command area while resolving the regional disputes over equitable water distribution in its judgement of September 2016. We demand that the same exercise be carried out for all upstream and downstream areas,” said Dhanorkar adding that the delineation process was one of the prerequisites for creating a sound platform of water distribution.

Leftist leader Vilas Babar said political functionaries cutting across party lines from the region should raise the pitch for releasing funds for the delineation of dams across the state. “As per initial reports, an estimated Rs 2,500 to Rs 3,000 crore is required for the delineation of the command area of Jayakwadi dam alone. Government agencies can make the best use of technology to cut down the cost. A team of experts must be constituted to expedite the process of delineation,” said Babar.

While the delineation process is expected to decide the quantum of water for irrigation needs, stakeholders demand that the process be first carried out for the upstream areas of Jayakwadi dam.

“Marathwada is a drought-prone region. Upstream areas in Ahmednagar and Nashik districts receive good amount of water in the catchment areas of the dam. The delineation process should be first carried out for the reservoirs in the Ahmednagar and Nashik districts before undertaking the procedure for the Jayakwadi dam,” said Dhanorkar.

When contacted, officials from the water resources department (WRD) said the state government had to take a policy decision on the delineation of dams. “The law mandates the delineation of dams and the process can be initiated only if funds are made available,” said a senior WRD official.

Title: FTII aspirants can apply for entrance test till January 31
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

File photo of FTII in Pune

PUNE: Film and Television Institute of India ( FTII ) and Satyajit Ray Film and Television Institute (SRFTI) have extended the application deadline for the Joint Entrance Test (JET) to January 31 to reach out to more applicants, especially from Jammu & Kashmir.

The earlier deadline was January 24. The test is the first step for prospective students of both the institutes, followed by counselling sessions. Students applying for the acting courses also need to audition. Officials, however, added that the test dates — February 15 and 16 — remain unchanged.

The extension is in line with the extension given in the past two years. Due to a clampdown on internet services in most parts of J&K, aspirants from there could not apply for the test.

“The extension is mainly for students in J&K. Internet services were not available in many parts of Kashmir, which is why they could not fill forms online. We have collaborated with the culture department of the Union territory.,” FTII director Bhupendra Kainthola said.

The extension will help students apply for the test for a lower fee announced by FTII and SRFTI earlier this month. The JET fees were slashed after a student stir led the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting to order a review.

Title: UP: Fire breaks out at BSNL godown
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

VARANASI: Property worth lakhs gutted in a major fire at BSNL godown in Jaunpur district on Monday.

As many as seven fire tenders including two from Varanasi were engaged to control the fire. It took around six hours to douse the flames. Fortunately, no casualty was reported in the incident.

According to reports, fire broke out in the godown located in Ishapur locality at around 3am. Initially, the guard tried to extinguish the fire, but it soon spread and engulfed the entire godown. Meanwhile, local residents gathered at the site and also informed the police and fire brigade.

Jaunpur district magistrate Dinesh Kumar and other senior officials also reached there. The BSNL authorities are assessing the loss caused by the fire. Bundles of cables and other goods were stored in the godown. Short-circuit is suspected to have caused the fire.

Title: SCR launches GPS to keep track of railway staff
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Aurangabad: The South Central Railway (SCR) has introduced a GPS-based biometric attendance system for the On-Board House Keeping Services (OBHS). Apart from that, the OBHS staff will have to post geo-tagged photos of their works accomplished on the official platform to ensure compliance.

The Indian Railways has been operating ‘Coach-Mitra’, an online application for the benefit of rail users, especially passengers onboard, to get assistance with regard to problems or deficiency in travel comforts like coach cleaning, water supply and lighting on trains among other areas. Introduced in 2016, the digital application with OBHS facility has been now extended to 2,167 trains, including 72 pairs of trains from the SCR.

“In SCR, the OBHS facility has been implemented successfully. On average, the zone receives 470 requests per month in Coach-Mitra to assist in resolving various issues. Nearly 90% of the service requests are being attended,” chief public relations officer of SCR, Ch Rakhes said.

To avail the facility, the passenger has to send a message to the designated mobile numbers. They can also use an app or webpage for logging the request. The request is immediately acknowledged via SMS along with a code.

“A message is also sent to the OBHS staff travelling on the same train along with the details of the passenger. As per the message received, the OBHS staff travelling contacts the passenger and carries out the work accordingly,” SCR authorities said.

If the passenger is satisfied with the work, he or she discloses the code received and OBHS staff, in turn, sends the same code through SMS to complete the cycle. If the passenger is not satisfied, he or she does not disclose the code and the complaint is reviewed further.

Title: Students to attend Chalo Delhi march
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: Student leaders from Maulana Azad National Urdu University (Manuu), University of Hyderabad (UoH), and English and Foreign Languages University (Eflu) will be participating in the ‘ Chalo Delhi ’ march in the capital against Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA), National Register of Citizens (NRC), and National Population Register (NPR) at Jantar Mantar on January 29.

The students from the city will be attending the Jansangharsh programme to create awareness on the issue and demand that the Centre revoke CAA and not implement NRC and NPR in any state.

“We will be attending the programme as speakers and co-organizers,” said Umar Faruq Quadri, president, student union of Mannu, who will be attending the programme in Delhi along with Intekhab Alam from union.

They said they would request citizens to boycott NRC, and urge them to not submit their details.

Title: AMU engineering students boycott pending examinations
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Agra: Aligarh Muslim University (AMU) engineering students on Monday boycotted their pending examinations which had been rescheduled twice after the December 15 violence that erupted on the campus.

The examinations scheduled to culminate on December 23 of the current academic session were postponed due to the clash between police and students on December 15. Subsequently, the varsity authorities advanced the winter vacations. The examinations were postponed again after the university reopened as protests by the students against the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) continued.

The students have been demanding resignations of the vice-chancellor and registrar accusing them of failing to protect students on the ill-fated day. Registrar of the university Abdul Hamid said that they are trying to convince the agitated students to appear for the examinations as they are losing the academic year. He said, “Even if we cancel the summer vacations of 45 days, they will be late in completing the academic session.”

While protests against CAA/NRC/NPR by the students continued in the campus on Monday, students from the faculty of Life Sciences and Commerce called a general body meeting on Tuesday to take a decision regarding boycott of examinations which are scheduled to start from Thursday.

Meanwhile, all students have decided to storm twitter with a hashtag “#AMUVCmustResign” on Monday night.

Title: 5 blind artists get Rs 1L financial aid
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Aurangabad: District guardian minister Dhananjay Munde handed over cheques for Rs 1 lakh each to five blind people from Beed during Republic Day parade at police ground on Sunday.

Munde, who is an MLA from Beed’s Parli assembly constituency, had visited Sakshal Pimpri in Beed taluka of the district on Friday. He met Nivrutti Kshirsagar, Vitthalbai Yadav Kshirsagar, their son Samrat, Rajabai Sathe, Murlidhar Sathe and Chaggubai Saathe — all blind from birth — in the village.

The two families, who are folk artists by profession, had reached out to Munde and shared their grievances. Munde had directed the social welfare additional commissioner to provide financial assistance to the two families under the Artistes’ Pension Scheme and Welfare Fund and other social welfare schemes of the state government.tnn

Title: PCMC needs 30 million litres a day more to restart daily water supply
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD : The civic body said it would continue with the alternate day water supply for the foreseeable future.

Pimpri Chinchwad municipal commissioner Shravan Hardikar said the civic body will need an additional 30 million litres a day (MLD) to restart the once-a-day water supply.

Despite heavy rains that had filled Pavana dam — the lifeline of the city — to 100%, complaints of inadequate of low-pressure water supply had persisted. This prompted PCMC to decide to supply water on alternate days for two months, starting November 25, to ensure equitable and adequate supply.

But the complaints persisted in many parts of the city, and residents have been demanding that the civic body restart the daily water supply. “We will continue with the alternate day water supply plan for now. We have improved water availability in areas on the fringes by diverting the surplus from areas getting excess water,” Hardikar said.

“We need an additional 30 MLD of water to provide adequate water to all parts of the city. We will be able to start one time daily water supply only then,” Hardikar further said.

Under the 27 MLD Wagholi rural water supply scheme, water from Pavana river is lifted at Ravet bund, purified at a water treatment plan in Chikhali and supplied to areas in Pune Municipal Corporation limits. PCMC asked PMC for this share of the water. “PMC agreed in principle to hand over this share of water once the Bhama Askhed pipeline is completed. We can get 30 MLD from this scheme,” Hardikar said.

Title: Experts urge Centre to up healthcare expenditure
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Jan-Arth Sankalpa, a group of experts that presented a shadow budget in the city last week, said the Centre should increase spending on welfare schemes, education and health care.

The experts said this can be done even by not disturbing the current allocation majorly in other sectors. “Tax-speculative trading, reversing the tax dole given to the big industry recently and re-imposing the erstwhile wealth tax can achieve this,” said Ajit Abhyankar , a member of Jan-Arth Sankalpa.

The group proposed that the healthcare expenditure in the upcoming Union Budget increase 40% to Rs88,000 crore, with a majority of the focus on the rural areas and providing medicines to government hospitals.

“A majority of the spends on health care are on outpatient department services and medicines. Only 3% of the people require hospitalization, so priorities need to be re-adjusted” said healthcare expert Anant Phadke.

The group also suggested that the Union government increase its spending on education by about 50% to about Rs1,43,000 crore. It said states must also follow suit and increase their allocations to both health and education. “Only then will the state of public education and infrastructure at public education institutes improve,” Sharad Javadekar of the Akhil Bharatiya Samajwadi Adhyapak Sabha said.

The members further urged the Centre to earmark at least Rs7,000 crore for walkways, bus tracks and cycle tracks. “The component of Metro rail/ MRT can be expanded to include mandatory walk, bus, cycle infrastructure improvements,” the experts said.

Title: Man dies in accident during R-Day procession
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Haridwar: A 28-year-old BJP worker died after he fell off a vehicle during a Tiranga Yatra organized on Republic day in Haridwar.

According to police, the deceased, Shankar Sharma, stood on a light loader vehicle and fell on the ground after the driver abruptly applied brakes to save a biker.

Police officials said they haven’t received a complaint in the matter so far.

Sharma, who was also the city head of Hindu Raksha Sena, was declared dead after he was rushed to the district hospital. Police have sent his body for post-mortem. “A Tiranga Yatra was organized by BJP on Monday. The rally was coming to Haridwar from Ranipur More area, where the accident took place. Shankar Sharma stood on a vehicle that was part of the procession. The driver suddenly applied brakes to save a biker who got in the way and Sharma was flung to the ground,” said local BJP leader Tarun Nayyar.

Station house officer (SHO) Jawalapur police station Yogesh Dev said that the accident took place around 3 pm on Sunday. Further investigation is on in the matter.

Title: Food served to children in villages of Malkangiri unsafe, says study
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Bhubaneswar: A study conducted by members of Right to Food Campaign has found that foodstuffs such as chhatua, sooji halua and groundnut ladu served to children and pregnant women at anganwadi centres in inaccessible areas of Malkangiri are not only of poor quality, but are positively unfit for consumption.

The members tested the food during visits to the Maoist-hit Chitrakonda block and the Bonda hills in Khairput block. They inspected the food distributed among beneficiaries of the state government’s Integrated Child Development Services as nutrition supplements.

“We examined and weighed the food packets in the presence of villagers. The food is of poor quality. The packets don’t even have enough food. In sooji halua, the sooji was not even fried,” said convener of the organisation, Pradip Pradhan.

In Jantapai and Paparamelta villages of Chitrakonda, the members found that each packet of chhatua fell short of the prescribed weight by 105 grams, while the groundnut packet fell short by 39 grams. Upon inquiry, an anganwadi worker said the annual requirement of rice at her centre was 3.5 quintal, but that the transport agent supplied 21kg less rice.

In Badapada village in Khairput, the members found that the anganwadi centre was running in the verandah of the villagers since the actual centre was under construction. “We found a number of malnourished children here,” Pradhan said.

The members found samples of parboiled rice, chhatua and groundnut ladus unsafe as per Food Safety and Security Act, 2006. The colour and the smell of the foodstuffs were off in most samples. Only the sooji halua was found to be satisfactory based on the tests performed.

“We have collected the samples and tested them in Bhubaneswar. The results were astonishing. All the food items, except for sooji, was found to be unsafe for consumption. The ICDS is to ensure that children eat nutritional food. Our findings have just proved that the project has failed big time,” Akhand Mishra, a member of the organisation, said.

Malkangiri collector Manish Agrawal told TOI that he would inquire into the matter and take action. “We haven’t received the report yet, but will initiate an inquiry into the matter. We will take strict action if anyone is found to have neglected their duty,” he said.

Title: Minister Neelkanth Tiwari inaugurates photo exhibition in Varanasi
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

An exhibition on Ganga Yatra was inaugurated in city on Monday

VARANASI: As UP Governor Anandiben Patel flagged-off the Ganga Yatra under Namami Gange programme of the Central government in Ballia on Monday, UP Minister of state (independent charge) for Tourism and Religious Works, Neelkanth Tiwari inaugurated a photo exhibition on Ganga Yatra evam Vikas at Cultural Complex, Chowkaghat.

The five-day Ganga Yatra commencing from Ballia and Bijnor will culminate at Kanpur on January 31. Speaking on the occasion, the minister said that the Ganga Yatra would cover a distance of 1,358 km passing through 27 districts, 21 local bodies and 38 gram panchayats. The villages situated along the banks of the Ganga would be identified for the development of a Bhagirath Circuit to promote tourism. The tourism department has been directed to prepare its DPR and sent to the Centre for approval. The development of Bhagirath Circuit would not only promote tourism but also help in economic growth of the villages, he added.

Title: Varanasi: Republic Day celebrated with patriotic fervour
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Students presenting a cultural performance at BHU

VARANASI: The city celebrated the Republic Day with patriotic fervour on Sunday. Celebrations were held at all government offices and educational institutions.

UP minister Anil Rajbhar hoisted National Flag and inspected the parade at Police Lines. Addressing the function, Rajbhar said that the country is touching new heights of development, and soon it would be in the league of developed nations.

The minister honoured freedom fighter BK Banerjee by presenting him a shawl on the occasion. Police personnel were also felicitated for their outstanding performance. Children of various school presented a colourful cultural programme.

On the initiative of divisional commissioner Deepak Agrawal, aanganwadi worker Pushpa Rani and helper Sarita Patel hoisted the National Flag at the commissioner office. Aanganwadi workers from different districts including Varanasi, Chandauli, Ghazipur and Jaunpur were feliciatetd by the commissioner on the occasion. After hoisting the tricolour at the collectorate, district magistrate Kaushal Raj Sharma felicitated freedom fighters.

To celebrate the day, students of IIT ( BHU ) donated 145 units of blood at a camp organized on the occasion. The functions were also held at Banaras Hindu University , Diesel Locomotive Works , railway offices, and private institutions.

Title: Leopard found dead in Nagbhid
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Chandrapur: A sub-adult leopard was found dead in Rengatondi forest under Nagbhid forest range under mysterious conditions on Monday morning.

The carcass was discovered by local foresters in Rengatondi beat of the range. Sources claimed that it was male tiger aged around two years. RFO Abhilasha Sontakke removed the carcass from the spot after necessary inquest formalities. The carcass was taken to Bramhapuri division office for post mortem, but was postponed due to the absence of a veterinary doctor.

The exact cause of death could not be ascertained. However all the precious body parts of the feline was found intact, sources claimed.

Title: Doon food safety dept issues notices to restaurants, online food delivery cos, asks them to ensure their personnel aren’t delivering drugs
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: Officials of the district Food and Drug Administration (FDA) in Dehradun have issued notices to several hotels, restaurants, dhabas and tiffin suppliers as well as online food delivery companies to ensure that their delivery personnel are not involved in supply of narcotic substances like charas, smack and ganja to students. The notices which were dispatched on January 25, also added that online food delivery chains must get their delivery partners registered with Food Safety and Standards Authority of India (FSSAI) so that “immediate action can be taken against them if they were found indulging in delivery of any banned substance.”

Yogendra Pandey, district food safety officer, told TOI that the notices were issued after the department received complaints that food delivery personnel were also acting as couriers for materials including alcohol, cigarettes, charas, smack, ganja etc, thereby making access of intoxicants easier for students. The notice sent by the department goes on to add that if any of the delivery personnel are found supplying narcotic substances, the respective company's licence will be cancelled and suitable action taken under the Food Safety and Standards Act, 2006.

“As per our intelligence inputs, the people who are delivering food are helping students get easy access to narcotics. This is being done at the behest of the drug cartel in the state which is using food delivery personnel to carry out its nefarious activities,” Pandey alleged.

Title: YSRC cites Chandrababu Naidu’s earlier stand to justify move to abolish council
Content:
File photo of Dharmana Prasada Rao

AMARAVATI: Pushing TDP president N Chandrababu Naidu into a corner, YSRC recalled his address in the assembly of undivided AP to defend the abolition of the legislative council on Monday.As opposition leader in 2005, Naidu had strongly opposed the revival of the legislative council. Naidu had said the council would only add burden to the exchequer. Naidu’s 2005 speech was screened during the debate in the assembly on Monday.Referring to Naidu’s speech, senior legislator Dharmana Prasada Rao asked why Naidu was opposing the abolition of the council when the YSRC government was fulfilling his dream. He said Naidu stayed away from the assembly for fear of reading out his own statements.He said Naidu never sticks to one policy, ideology or a stance as he keeps changing decisions to suit his political convenience.“As an opposition, the Telugu Desam Party will give high priority to people’s interests and, hence, is opposing the proposal for the council’s revival. It might serve creating a few jobs to the followers of the ruling party not the people. In fact, the council is a big burden on the exchequer,” said Naidu during his speech in the assembly while taking on the then government’s proposal to revive the council.Dharmana said Naidu should have welcomed YSRC decision. He said that Naidu had dubbed the council as a chamber to rehabilitate political leaders and activists. He said that chief minister Y S Jaganmohan Redddy had come to a conclusion that there was no need to burden the people to create employment to some political leaders.He said that the council instead of giving wise advice to the assembly has become a roadblock in making laws needed by the people. He criticized Naidu for using the legislative council for undermining the peoples’ verdict. He said that Jagan had received 51% vote share in the assembly election.He said that getting such an overwhelming mandate is rare and Naidu was trying to tweak the people’s verdict through the council. He recalled remarks of Dr BR Ambedkar who said that setting up of the council was only a temporary measure, not permanent one.He asked why the Naidu government had not sent the CRDA bill which contains 171 pages to the select committee in 2015 while referring the decentralization bill with 12 pages to the select committee.Transport minister Perni Nani ripped through Naidu’s frequent U-turns on major political decisions. He said that Naidu vowed not to allow Prime Minister Narendra Modi to address a public meeting and sent black balloons into air during the election campaign.

Title: YSRC tries to underplay 18 MLA no-show
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Andhra Pradesh chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy

AMARAVATI: The absence of 18 legislators out of 151 from the assembly on Monday during the debate and subsequent voting on the resolution to abolish the council is believed to have irked the YSRC leadership. All members, including chief minister Jaganmohan Reddy and ministers, stood in their places for over 20 minutes till the completion of counting process , which saw the resolution passed by a 133-0 verdict.

The CM is believed to have directed chief whip Gadikota Srikanth Reddy to summon the legislators who stayed away from voting and ask for explanation. Sources, however, said many legislators were unaware of the voting process and left the House as there was no communication from party whips. “It happened due to communication gap. The issuance of whip would have made them stay in the House. It’s mainly due to lack of clarity and communication gap. There is nothing to suspect, but we will still ask them to explain,” said a senior minister.

Government whip Chevireddy Bhaskara Reddy was among those who failed to cast his vote as the assembly speaker ordered the closure of all doors soon after the resolution was taken up for voting. Chevireddy had rushed out just before the doors closed to call other legislators. Kapu corporation chairman Dadisetti Raja and senior party leader Kolusu Pardhasaradhi were also stranded outside at the time.

Title: Allahabad: Tutor kills boy, dumps body in well, held two months later
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: The private tutor of a six-year-old boy was arrested on Monday for murdering him two months ago. The decomposed body of the boy was recovered in Soraon on Monday.

According to police, Kuwar Bhan Singh alias Tuntun, 34, a resident of Gohri village, has confessed to the crime.

Inspector (Soraon) Anil Kumar Singh told TOI that Singh was a private tutor to victim Anand alias Changoo (6). On the evening of November 13, he had thrashed the boy severely in a fit of age after he failed to learn a lesson, he told police.

As a result, the boy’s head collided with a nearby wall and he began bleeding from his ear and mouth, Singh said.

The SHO further added, “When Singh noticed that the boy was not responding and was unconscious, he took his body to a nearby field and threw it into a dry well. The accused also confessed he covered the dry well with grass so that no one would notice it.”

When the boy did not return home, his family members began looking for him. After a search, they lodged a complaint that Anand was missing.

They also asked Singh, whom the family knew well, about Anand. Singh told the family that Anand had not come to study that evening. Singh also assured police he would inform them if he got to know anything about the boy.

Since November, police were investigating the case.

On Monday, the police rounded up Singh after clues led to him and quizzed him. Singh then confessed to have killed the boy and also led to the site where the body was buried.

A police team recovered the skeleton of Anand outside Vikas Ka Pura village.

Title: UP: Get your queries answered on Mela Rail Seva 2020 app
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: As the ongoing Magh Mela continues to draw a huge number of pilgrims from all corners of the country, the North Central Railways (NCR) have developed a dedicated mobile app—Mela Rail Seva 2020—a ‘one stop window’ for all queries related to Magh Mela-2020 services and facilities.

“We have developed this app specially for the mela yatris who have arrived or who are planning to come to Sangam city for the ongoing Magh Mela. The app has a variety of features and provides different information like passenger amenities at station, originating Magh Mela special trains, passenger rest rooms and facilities at station besides relevant information regarding ticket counters at station, location of entrance gates at station, Yatri accommodations etc,” said Ajit Kumar Singh, chief public relations officer (CPRO), NCR.

Besides, the app also has helpline numbers, ‘RPF for You’ options and official bathing dates to help the tourists and pilgrims. The 4.2 MB app is available for free download on the Google playstore.

Another option in the app ‘Yatri Rasta’ guides pilgrims by providing the location from the given options like railway station, mela zone, mandir, mall, bus stand, Allahabad airport to hospital and then chose destination. The app provides route, time to reach the destination and the distance in kilometers, explained Singh. Similarly, ‘On Call Services’ option allows a tourist or pilgrim to connect to e-catering and food plaza while helpline numbers provide contact numbers of general inquiry, railway police, catering complaint/suggestion, grievance, lost and missing child help etc, he added.

Details about Mahatma gallery at stations, ‘postal services near you’, CCTV control at station, child missing point at station and yatri ticket modes are also available through this app.

Title: 2 quarantined in Pune, NIV to confirm coronavirus infection
Content:
Representative image

Lohegaon airport officials on alert

PUNE: Two travellers , who recently returned from Shanghai and another city in China, were quarantined at the Pune Municipal Corporation’s (PMC) Naidu Infectious Diseases Hospital on Monday after they complained of minor influenza-like symptoms including cold and fever. Both are residents of Pune.Civic health officials on Monday sent the throat swab sample of one of the travellers to the city-based National Institute of Virology (NIV) for testing. The NIV has been designated as a referral laboratory for the testing and confirmation of the novel coronavirus infection in India.Three more travellers from Pimpri Chinchwad have been quarantined at home as they have been unsymptomatic so far. The samples of three travellers who were isolated at Kasturba hospital in Mumbai turned negative last week.Ramchandra Hankare, public health expert and PMC health department chief, said, “One of the travellers quarantined at Naidu hospital, a 51-year-old man, had recently returned from Shanghai. The other man, aged 30, had been to a city close to Wuhan in China. Both have developed minor illness in the form of cold and fever. They have been isolated only as a precautionary measure.”Hankare said that the throat swab sample of the 51-year-old man has been sent to NIV and the report is expected on Tuesday. The sample of the other man will be sent to NIV on Tuesday.Meanwhile, as many as 3,756 passengers returning from China and other coronavirus-affected countries have so far been screened at Mumbai’s Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) since January 18. Of them, 15 travellers from Pune, Mumbai, Kalyan, Vasai and Virar have been kept under surveillance for the next 28 days. Six of them have been quarantined — four in Mumbai and two in Pune."Barring these six travellers, none of the others have developed any illness. We are keeping a track of their health by making telephone calls. We have also asked them to report to us if they develop any symptoms,” state surveillance officer Pradip Awate said.Awate said that any airborne virus usually has an incubation period of 7 to 14 days. “But since this is the new variant of coronavirus, we don’t have conclusive information about its incubation period. Therefore, we have doubled the passenger tracking period,” he said.The state government on Monday decided to track and follow up on travellers who returned from China between January 1 and 17. The decision was taken during a meeting chaired by the state’s principal secretary Pradip Vyas on Monday. Presently, only travellers who returned from China after January 18 are being screened by state health officials.“We have also decided to carry out repeat tests of those who tested negative in earlier tests, including three Mumbai travellers. We will activate helpline 104 to handle people’s queries on coronavirus infection,” Awate said.Airports Authority of India said it was coordinating with the Pune customs officials to monitor potential coronavirus cases. “There are no medical checks in Pune, but immigration officials are monitoring arriving passengers and suspicious cases will be referred to the health department,” G Chandramouli, AAI western regional director, said.Pune doesn’t have a flight to/from China or anywhere in southeast Asia. But many foreign travelers arrive here via transit.

Title: ‘Tainted’ construction firm allowed to carry on with city airport work
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Bhubaneswar: The collapse of the under-construction roof of a building connecting two terminals at Biju Patnaik International Airport (BPIA) here on Friday that killed a labourer has thrust private construction agency Dillip Constructions Private Limited to the limelight. Sources in the Airports Authority of India (AAI) said Dillip Constructions Private Limited was last year restrained from taking up any AAI work in the country.

The prohibited vendors’ list, uploaded on the AAI website, feature the name of Dillip Constructions Private Limited. According to the website, the AAI issued an order on March 22, 2019, barring the private agency from taking up any AAI tender for its poor performance.

Biju Patnaik airport authorities said the private construction firm had bagged the tender to construct the link building (whose roof collapsed) between domestic and international terminals in 2018. “We are aware that the agency has been barred. This was done for slow pace of work. The agency was restrained in 2019 from taking up any new AAI project but was asked to complete the ongoing project,” airport director V V Rao said.

Asked whether the same firm will be allowed to complete the work, Rao said, “The AAI will take the decision.”

Sources said the project started in February 2019 and was expected to be over within a year. The cost of the two-storey terminal linking project was Rs 56 crore out of which Rs 3 crore work has been completed. The rebuilding of the collapsed roof would cost around Rs 25 lakh.

Senior BJP spokesperson Gollak Mahapatra questioned the engagement of the agency in the airport construction work. “Even though the order was issued in 2019, the agency should not have been allowed to construct the link building. The agency should also not be allowed to complete the project,” Mahapatra said. Meanwhile, the AAI has completed a preliminary inquiry into Friday’s mishap but neither the AAI nor the BPIA officials disclosed the findings of the initial probe. Two AAI officials, an executive engineer and a general manager, from Kolkata reached Bhubaneswar on Saturday and conducted the preliminary inquiry into the circumstances that led to the mishap. They will submit their report the AAI headquarters. Sources said another team of experts from the AAI headquarters in Delhi is likely to visit the Bhubaneswar airport soon to conduct a full-fledged inquiry into the tragedy.

A joint technical committee, constituted by the commissionerate police to probe the airport roof collapse, strongly suspects that the contractor did not adopt adequate safety measures and allegedly compromised with the quality of work. The joint technical committee has forensic experts from the state forensic science laboratory (SFSL) and engineers from the state works department.

Additional commissioner of police Anup Kumar Sahoo said the joint technical committee has been asked to furnish the report at the earliest. A day after the tragedy, the police had arrested the construction company’s owner Dilip Khatei, supervisor Abhilash Sarkar and two AAI engineers — Gautam Ray and Ashis Sarkar — for their alleged negligence leading to the collapse of the airport roof.

Title: Criminal case against six University of Hyderabad students
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

University of Hyderabad

HYDERABAD: Cyberabad police registered a criminal case against six students of University of Hyderabad (UoH) for trying to take out a rally on Sunday. Gachibowli police said a case was registered against UoH students’ union president Abhishek Nandan and five others students.

On Republic Day, a section of the students wanted to take out ‘Save Constitution’ march from the campus to Ambedkar statue in Masjid Banda area. But, cops restrained the protesters by closing the university gate. In the melee, some of the students allegedly clashed with cops.

UOH Students Union said that police allegedly mishandled protesters. “The police without citing any valid reason threatened students and tried to detain few of them. They locked the main gate for 5 hours there by not allowing students to proceed with their rally,’’ students union said. The students also burnt effigies of varsity administration and the police for filing the FIR and detention of Chandra Shekar Azad.

Title: Indore: Ride till doorstep, routewise permit for e-rickshaws soon
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

INDORE: Atal Indore City Transport Services Limited (AICTSL) may soon start issuing permits for e-rickshaws being run in city. Routes would soon be identified after survey to assess viability in areas that are not connected by public transport and permits for specific routes would be given.

The move is aimed at regulating routes of e-rickshaws being run by individuals to increase connectivity options of public transport for citizens, said officials on Monday.

There are around 1500 e-rickshaws including 100 that are being run under AICTSL in city. However, most of these e-rickshaws run on routes which already have availability of other passenger vehicles like buses, vans and rickshaws.

This prompted officials to plan for an arrangement, where e-rickshaw operators could be assigned certain routes to provide connectivity options for citizens from their respective localities to their nearby bus stops.

A final decision in this regard was taken on Monday convened at AICTSL Office on Monday.

IMC commissioner Asheesh Singh , who chaired the meeting instructed officials to send a proposal to state government seeking permission.

The commissioner also instructed AICTSL officials to conduct a survey and identify routes in residential and commercial areas, where there is no reach of city buses.

This arrangement would work in the same manner that it works for passenger vehicles like buses, vans, where their owners have to obtain permit from transport department to pick and drop passengers on different routes, said officials.

AICTSL chief executive officer Sandeep Soni said that if the proposal is approved by the government, then they will come out with an arrangement, where e-rickshaws operators will be allotted different routes or areas, where there is no availability of public transport.

“The entire idea is to provide last mile connectivity options of public transport service for citizens to improve traffic condition in city. We also have plans to introduce around 500 more e-rickshaws in city,” he said.

Title: Woman denied entry into labour room, delivers on floor outside, baby dies
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Ludhiana: Highlighting the shockingly callous attitude of the hospital staff, a 28-year-old pregnant woman was forced to deliver her baby outside the mother and childcare unit of civil hospital on Sunday. The baby had died on birth, said the mother. Allegedly, the hospital staff had not only told her that there was no doctor to attend to her, but they also refused to let her inside the labour room stating that she would “dirty it”.

Family members of the patient, Lalita Devi, and her neighbour alleged that even as she kept screaming in pain for hours on Sunday morning and kept walking to the labour room for help, the staff on duty kept turning her away. According to her family, around 11.30am on Sunday, she delivered a girl baby on the floor in the lobby of the mother and childcare unit.

According to the family, there wasn’t a single doctor present due to holiday. The family alleged that one staff nurse and two helpers, including a class-IV employee, were attending to the patients in the labour ward.

Lalita Devi, wife of Phool Chand from Durga Colony of Dhandari Kalan, said, “On Sunday morning, my contractions started and my neighbour had called the ambulance. We were taken to the mother and childcare unit of the civil hospital but the hospital staff refused to treat me. They said I will dirty the hospital. Following this, I slumped down on the floor and delivered a pre-mature baby, who died immediately.”

Urmila Devi, the neighbour of Lalita, said, “Some nurses were available inside the labour room, but no one bothered even though she kept on screaming. Soon her water broke, and she urinated and defecated in the visitor’s chair in the lobby. I went away to get her fresh clothes. During this time, she delivered a baby girl on the floor, which died later.”

“The way Lalita was screaming in pain, we thought hospital staff must be aware of the emergency, but they kept turning her away. When we started questioning them, they asked us to keep quiet and not make videos,” said Urmila.

Manjeet Singh, another neighbour of Lalita, said, “Lalita’s husband is a daily-wage worker and was busy in his work. He had asked me to look after his wife in the hospital. When I reached there, I was shocked to see the callous attitude of the hospital staff and how they had refused a pregnant woman entry into the labour room. I then called 104, the complaint number of the health department, for registering a complaint about the hospital staff.”

However, the hospital staff on duty have denied the allegations of their negligence.

Civil surgeon Rajesh Kumar Bagga said, “The matter of pre-mature delivery of a baby on the floor of mother and child hospital by a local woman came to my notice on Monday. Sometimes, labour contractions get intensive very quickly, this could be the case here, but I don’t know exactly. I will soon initiate an investigation into this to find out what exactly happened.”

Meanwhile, health and family welfare minister Balbir Singh Sidhu said, “I will soon initiate an inquiry into the matter. I will ask for a report on the complaint registered on helpline number 104.”

Title: 20 cops forced to retire for criminal activities, dereliction of duty in Jan
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Ludhiana: The commissioner of police, Rakesh Agarwal, served forced retirement notices on 20 cops in January. While some of these cops were involved in crimes, others were found guilty of dereliction of duty.

On January 22, the city police had arrested assistant sub-inspector Sukhpal Singh, who was deputed at Jamalpur police station, in an attempt to murder case. The ASI, who was later forced to retire, had shot at his live-in partner with his service revolver at her house here.

During investigation, the police had found that the ASI was earlier booked under the Gambling Act at Division 6 police station.

On November 19, the Special Task Force had arrested constable Amandeep Singh, who was deputed at Police Lines, with 51gm heroin. After his arrest, the police identified that the constable had been absent from duty for a month. “However, his absence went unnoticed, with no official trying to probe into his long leaves,” said a cop.

Agarwal said, “After cops were arrested for their involvement in illegal activities, it was identified during investigations that most of them were either irregular on duty or had some other complaints or inquires marked against them. Now, we are checking the records of all cops, whether they have FIRs registered against them or are guilty of dereliction of duty.”

“This month, notices of forced retirement have been issued to 20 cops. These cops are from the ranks of constable to assistant sub-inspector. They include not just those personnel who were involved in criminal activities but also those guilty of dereliction of duty. They were issued notices after a thorough probe. After I joined as Ludhiana commissioner of police last year, 25 cops had been forced to retire or dismissed,” he added.

Cops in thick of controversies

December 20, 2019: Head constable Balbir Singh arrested for extorting Rs 6 lakh from pharmacist Swaran Singh of Rajguru Nagar with the help of his aide. After receiving Rs 6 lakh, the cop allegedly sought another Rs 4 lakh, threatening to trap the pharmacist in a case of selling intoxicating pills

November 24, 2019: STF arrested ASI Jagjit Singh and his accomplices Angrej Singh and Kajhwinder Singh with 500gm opium. The ASI was deputed as naib reader with additional deputy commissioner of police (headquarters) for 11 years.

October 19, 2019: Head constable Gurpreet Singh and his accomplices Dharminder Singh and Anju Bharti arrested for peddling drugs. Babbu Bharti, husband of Anju, was running a drug nexus with the help of trio. At least 12gm heroin and 10gm charas were recovered from them. The head constable was dismissed after his arrest

August 11, 2019: STF arrested head constable Gagandeep Singh, deputed as munshi at Sadar police station of Khanna, and his two accomplices Amandeep Singh of Kidwayi Nagar and Vikas Kumar of Rishi Nagar with 785gm heroin. The head constable was later dismissed from services

Title: Man thrashes 4-yr-old nephew to death
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Chandrapur: A man allegedly killed his four-year-old nephew at Warvat village on Chandrapur city’s outskirts on Monday morning. Dikshant was playing with his sister when the accused, identified as Rangnath, without any provocation started thrashing the tiny tot with a stick on his legs and head.

A profusely bleeding Dikshant was rushed to government hospital in Chandrapur but he succumbed to injuries while undergoing treatment.

Locals nabbed Rangnath and thrashed him before tying him up with a pole. Durgapur police later arrested Rangnath. The reason behind Rangnath’s step could not be ascertained till the time of going to press.

Title: Hyderabad: Bike with family of 5 hits divider, father & son die
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: A man and his three-year-old son died in an accident after he rammed the bike into a road divider in Keesara on Sunday evening. The police said that five people were travelling on the bike at the time of the accident.

Keesara police said that 25-year-old Suresh Kumar, who is a manual labourer, migrated from Chhattisgarh to the city a few years ago and has been living here since.

On Sunday evening after attending a function at Nagaram, Suresh and his family were returning to their house in Bandlaguda. Apart from Suresh, his wife Rajini, their two sons, and his brother-in-law Uday were travelling on the bike.

At Keesara, Suresh who was allegedly riding the bike at high speed lost control and rammed into the divider. All five fell off the bike. While Suresh died on the spot, the four others who were injured were shifted to hospital.His three-year-old son Sagar was declared dead on arrival at the hospital.
