He said new buildings of 95 police stations in the state were being constructed as part of modernising the force. “Our force successfully curbed gangster culture in three years and even gangsters were extradited from abroad. There are only three to four dreaded gangsters outside the police net, who our teams are trying to arrest,” he said, after inaugurating the new building of Kathgarh police station here on Saturday.

Title: BJP likely to pick party’s next state chief in 2 weeks
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The national leadership of the BJP is likely to take a final call on the party’s state president in a week or two.

While incumbent president Kanna Lakshminaryana is keen to complete his three-year term and has already conveyed his desire to senior leaders of the party, there are speculations that there could be a change in state leadership, considering that the power centre is likely to shift to north Andhra Pradesh soon after Visakhapatnam becomes the executive capital of the state.

Among those vying for the post is BJP MLC P V N Madhav, whose family has been associated with the saffron party for more than five decades.

Others in the race include former Union minister D Purandeswari and P Manikyala Rao, who was the state endowments minister from 2014 to 2018 before the TDP decided break its alliance with BJP in the state.

Lakshminaryana who was appointed state president of BJP in 2018, was previously with the Congress. He lost the 2019 parliamentary elections from Narasaraopet.

His becoming the party’s state president soon after switching over from the Congress came as a surprise, because the saffron party normally prefers long-time party loyalists for such posts.

Madhav, the party’s MLC from Uttarandhra Graduate constituency, could be the frontrunner for the post if the central leadership decides to replaceLakshminaryana.

Another BJP MLC, Somu Veerraju, may get the nod if the party decides to field someone from the Kapu community.

“If the BJP leadership prefers to have someone young, then Madhav is likely to get the job as age is on his side. His family has remained loyal to the party since the Jan Sangh days. His father PV Chalapati Rao was a member of the Jan Sangh, while Madhav has been with the party through its ups and downs for close to two decades now,” a BJP source said.

Title: YSRC supporters burn effigies of Naidu during protest march
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Warning the TDP that they would lose out in the upcoming local body elections, leaders of YSRC took out a massive rally in the city, condemning the TDP and its chief for trying to ruin the aspirations of the people of north coastal Andhra.

The YSRC functionaries, led by the city president Vamsi Krishna Srinivas Yadav, took out a rally from Dabagardens junction to the GVMC Gandhi Statue junction, raising slogans against the TDP and its chief. The protesters also burnt effigies of the TDP chief and senior party leaders claiming that the TDP was doing their best to stall the decentralisation and development in the state.

Yadav said, “On one hand we have a CM who wants to decentralise the development and on the other we have an opposition leader who is hell-bent on blocking the development.”

Title: CAA Protest Delhi: Police stop a Shaheen Bagh-like protest near Nizamuddin Basti in Delhi
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

The protesters, however, were camping on the footpath in front of Musafirkhana Park till Monday evening.

NEW DELHI: An attempt to start a Shaheen Bagh-like sit-in protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act was foiled on Lodhi Road late on Sunday when police forcefully evicted protesters gathering on a stretch near Nizamuddin Basti and cordoned off the area through the night.

The protesters, however, were camping on the footpath in front of Musafirkhana Park till Monday evening. Efforts are being made to shift them into the park to avoid congestion during peak hours. The cops are also not allowing any more people to enter the protest site.

The stretch connects Mathura Road to the Barapullah flyover, which has been handling an increased volume of traffic due to the Kalindi Kunj road closure since the beginning of the protests at Shaheen Bagh . Any chaos on this stretch will choke the whole artery connecting central Delhi to south-east Delhi, a police officer said. “With the Kalindi Kunj stretch already blocked, a choke point near Nizamuddin will add to the commuters’ woes during the peak hours,” he added.

Around 9pm on Sunday, locals started gathering at the traffic island under the Lodhi Road flyover, and a group of women even set up plastic tents. As the cops, who were already expecting a gathering, tried to convince them to move to the nearby park, the protesters got agitated. With messages about the “possible police brutalities” getting circulated on WhatsApp, more people turned up and the cops finally forced some of them to shift to the park and cordoned off the area.

A video of the incident also went viral on social media. It showed some protesters trying to confront police when they were being shifted from the site.

The altercation went on till late in the night after which the protesters agreed to restrict the sit-in to the footpath with 50-60 people. However, a crowd from the locality soon reached the spot, swelling the numbers. “We’ve managed to contain the protesters, and are trying to shift them to the park. We’ve assured them that adequate security will be given,” said a cop.

As a precautionary measure, the cops are scanning vehicles carrying groups of people going towards Nizamuddin. The traffic, too, is being diverted through the Lodhi flyover or Mathura Road to avoid congestion. A large number of personnel has also been deployed to avoid any untoward incident near a temple behind Nizamuddin Basti.

Meanwhile, the special investigation team has been asked to probe the background of a group of women who has allegedly been spotted at different protests as DU, Jamia or JNU students. The probe has been ordered after a woman leading a group has allegedly been captured on a video misbehaving with police.

Title: VMC’s junior clerk held for accepting Rs 4,000 bribe
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: A junior clerk of Vadodara Municipal Corporation’s (VMC) revenue department was arrested by the anti-corruption bureau (ACB) on Monday for accepting a bribe of Rs 4,000 from an owner of a plot.

The accused Gopal Rana, had demanded the bribe to hand over tax bill to the plot owner. ACB officials said that the plot owner wanted to start paying civic tax for his open plot for which he had given an application. In response to the application, Rana handed over the tax bill to the complainant, but demanded that he be paid Rs 4,000 for the work he did.

The complainant contacted ACB as he did not want to pay bribe. ACB sleuths laid a trap and as per the plan, the complainant asked Rana to meet him near Makarpura GIDC so that he can hand over the cash. As Rana accepted the cash, ACB officials nabbed him.

Title: Body of 2-year old missing boy found in US Nagar
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Rudrapur: The body of a two-year-old boy, who was missing since Sunday afternoon, was found in a field near his house in Dhakiya Gulabo village of Kashipur in Udham Singh Nagar district on Monday. It is suspected that the boy was murdered and his body was dumped in the field. His body was spotted by local boys who were playing in the field.

Rajesh Bhatt, assistant superintendent of police (ASP) of Kashipur, said, “The body has been sent for autopsy to ascertain the exact cause of death. We are also questioning the victim’s relatives.”

ASP Bhatt said, “Earlier, on Sunday, the boy’s father, Maan Singh, had lodged a complaint with police that his son Raghav alias Anshu, went missing while playing outside his house. We will add relevant IPC sections to the FIR after post-mortem.”

Title: ‘Strengthen BJP, be ready for elections’
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Chandigarh: BJP Punjab president Ashwani Sharma on Monday asked all district and block presidents of the party to reach out to people to raise awareness about Citizenship (Amendment) Act.

This was Sharma’s first meeting with the party’s 33 district presidents and 380 block presidents after he took charge of the party’s state unit on January 17. He urged the block and district chiefs to strengthen the organisation collectively and start preparing for the 2022 state elections. The meeting lasted three hours.

Sharma went on to claim that opposition parties were misleading people on CAA. “Muslims are in majority in Pakistan, Afghanistan and Bangladesh. Therefore, they cannot be persecuted in these countries. We need to provide protection to people of other religions,” he added.

Title: Edappadi K Palaniswami, O Panneerselvam pull up ministers for poor civic poll performance
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Edapaddi K Palaniswami and O Panneerselvam talked tough, asking ministers to buck up for the elections ahead

CHENNAI: In a bid to put their house in order, chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami and his deputy O Panneerselvam on Monday held meetings for three hours with members of the cabinet at the state secretariat. They addressed groups of ministers besides having one-on-one interactions at the secretariat. The leaders are said to be upset over the lack of coordination, internal feuding and open bickering impacting the AIADMK’s prospects in the recently held rural local body elections, and ahead of the crucial urban civic polls .

Pointing to the not very laudable rural local body election results, Palaniswami and Panneerselvam talked tough, asking ministers to buck up for the elections ahead. A majority of them are district secretaries. With the party performing badly on their turf, they were issued a stern warning, sources privy to the meeting told TOI.

Incidentally, EPS had a separate one-on-one meeting with Panneerselvam for an hour, before his interactions with the ministers. The meetings that began around 5pm went on for close to three hours in the chief minister’s chamber in the presence of CM’s confidantes and ministers, P Thagamani and S P Velumani. “The meeting was called to discuss the local body poll results in view of the upcoming urban local body elections and 2021 assembly polls,” said a minister, seeking anonymity. “The leadership summoned ministers who were in Chennai. Ministers in charge of districts that lost to the DMK narrowly were asked to do better,” said the minister.

The ruling party won 209 district panchayat ward seats as against the DMK’s 244, and 1,779 panchayat union ward seats as against the DMK’s 2,090. While violence and cross-voting marred the indirect elections across the state, the AIADMK bagged 14 district panchayat president posts, leaving 12 to the DMK and one to its ally, the PMK. Infighting in the district units, allegations against local ministers not taking along the party MLAs dented the AIADMK’s prospects in several districts. Recently, former minister and Perundurai MLA Thoppu N D Venkatachalam accused environment minister K C Karupannan of fielding independents in Perundurai panchayat union. Venkatachalam told TOI that Karupannan showed disrespect to old-timers.

The stock-taking comes ahead of the urban local body polls, which may be scheduled in March or April, after delimitation of the newly constituted nine districts. “The two leaders told the ministers how to work for the elections and how to coordinate with the elected MLAs in the districts for better results. The ministers were asked to show results,” said a source. A few senior party leaders recalled former chief minister J Jayalalithaa holding a similar closed-door session in June 2012, with the elected councillors of the Chennai Corporation in a corporation-owned hall in the city. In the wake of complaints of inefficiency, she had threatened to dissolve the elected council and run the corporation with the help of special officers if they did not mend their ways, they said.

Title: Actress attack: Dileep questions joint trial
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Kochi: Actor Dileep has approached the high court challenging the alleged move to conduct a joint trial in the actress attack case and the blackmailing case registered based on his complaint against ‘Pulsar’ Suni and other accused.

According to the petition, a lower court has scheduled both the actress attack case and the blackmailing case to be tried jointly. The blackmailing case was registered on Dileep’s complaint that Suni and two other accused contacted him over phone while they were in jail and tried to blackmail him. Alleging misjoinder of parties and offences, Dileep contends that accused offenders and complainant have been scheduled to be tried together by the lower court and that it is an abuse of process of law and would cause him prejudice. tnn

Title: ‘Those inciting anti-CAA stir not fit to lead community’
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Panaji: After the Church-backed anti-CAA protest held in South Goa last week, Vishwa Hindu Parishad’s ( VHP ) general secretary Milind Parande said that despite central government ’s assurance, if anyone is inciting persons of his community against the CAA , then that person is not fit to lead the community.

Parande also called the country-wide demonstrations against CAA ‘managed’ and said that those protesting the act have been incited for selfish political gains ‘by some political parties’.

“In Goa also, I am aware that people are making statements that citizenship of persons here will be affected.When nobody’s citizenship is being taken away, what are they talking about? Any Indian citizen need not worry about their citizenship. The government has already given this assurance. And despite this assurance, if someone is trying to incite people, then the person is not leading his community in the right direction. People should think about such wrong leadership,” Parande said in Panaji on Monday.

He added that those involved in violence in the name of demonstrating against CAA should be prosecuted.

Title: Call for police action into student’s death
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The death of a 17-year-old girl under suspicious circumstances led to protests by the family, relatives and locals at Palasa in Srikakulam district on Monday. The agitators demanded the police initiate action against those responsible for the death of the girl.

It may be recalled that the 17-year-old girl was a first-year Intermediate student at a private college. She was found lifeless near a railway track at Dharmapuram village under Palasa Government Railway Police (GRP) station limits in the district in the early hours of Sunday.

The girl’s parents have alleged that their daughter was kidnapped, raped and then murdered by one of her friends. They also alleged that the boy, who is also a student at the same private college, had been stalking her on the pretext of being in love with her, and then killed her.

Based on the complaint from the victim’s parents, GRP personnel at Palasa registered a case under kidnap and murder and shifted the body to a government hospital for an autopsy.

Palasa GRP sub-inspector said the case would be transferred to Srikakulam police for further investigation as the case is suspected to be one of kidnap, rape and murder. Further investigation is necessary to ascertain the reasons behind the death, the sub-inspector said.

Multiple injuries were found on the victim’s body. Police are awaiting the post-mortem report.

Title: Water supply in some Vadodara areas affected due to leakage
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: A pipeline supplying water to the city from the French wells in Mahi river was damaged near Sankarda. Water supply to some pockets in the northern and southern parts of the city was affected due to the leakage.

According to Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) officials, the leakage had come to light early on Monday morning. The line is old and work on an alternative line there is reaching completion. Sources said that the water was diverted to the new line as work on it from Sankarda to the city had been completed.

The affected areas will be supplied water from the new line till the old one is repaired. Once the new pipeline is ready, it will be used regularly instead of the old pipeline.

Title: Asembly polls: BJP’s Dhan Singh Rawat in Delhi to woo voters
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: Ahead of the crucial assembly election in Delhi, BJP leader Dhan Singh Rawat has been given the task of mobilising party cadre to woo over 30 lakh Delhi voters who are from Uttarakhand and hold the key for the saffron party.

In Delhi, the poll campaigning has picked up pace and scores of BJP cadres from other states, including Uttarakhand, have been called in to work in all the 70 assembly seats.

Dhan Singh Rawat, too, is camping in Delhi focusing on all the assembly seats falling in the east Delhi region. Speaking with TOI, Rawat said, “We have mapped out the pockets where people — over 30 lakh — of Uttarakhand are living and a door-to-door campaign is underway by our cadre. In the coming weeks, several senior BJP leaders, including MPs and the CM would join the campaign here.” Apart from Rawat, BJP has planned a series of meeting of MPs such as Ajay Bhatt (Nainital), Ajay Tamta (Almora), and Tirath Singh Rawat (Pauri Garhwal). Campaigning will end on February 7, and Delhi will go to polls on February 8.

Title: Bangladesh issues release order for eight north AP fishermen
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: The Bangladesh government on Monday issued the release order for eight fisherman from north Andhra who have been in a Bangladeshi jail since October 2, 2019. The Indian high commission in Dhaka has confirmed the development.

The Bangladesh Coast Guard had detained these eight fishermen — who were sailing on a boat ‘Amrutha’ — for straying into the neighbouring country’s waters in October last year.

The fishermen had been handed over to Mongla police in Bagerhat district in Bangladesh and a case was registered under the Marine Fisheries Ordinance, 1983. Bagerhat senior judicial magistrate court had sent the fishermen to jail custody.

Confirming the developments, an official from the high commission’s office told TOI, “We have been pursuing this release order for the past few months and finally managed to convince them.”

On November 28, TOI reported that Bangladesh might release the eight fishermen soon after the police report claimed that no fishing nets or catch were seized from the boat and the vessel had entered the Bangladeshi territory owing to inclement weather.

“Now that the release order has been issued, the process of sending them back will be initiated. Soon, the fishermen will be handed over to the Indian Border Security Force,” Milon Banerjee, the fishermen’s lawyer, told TOI.

All eight fishermen are from Thippalavalasa village in Vizianagaram district, but have been living in Visakhapatnam.

Earlier, Visakhapatnam MP MVV Satyanarayana had requested the Union minister for external affairs S Jaishankar to intervene in the matter to ensure the fishermen return home soon.

In October 2019, 38 Indian fishermen were detained in Bangladesh, of which 30 fishermen were from West Bengal. The high commission had confirmed that the Bangladesh government had issued a release order for all the Indian fishermen.

On January 6 this year, the Pakistan government released 22 fishermen from Srikakulam district who had been lodged in a Karachi jail since November 2018.

Title: TTD to spend Rs 14cr for admin bldg facelift
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Tirupati: The administrative building of Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanams is set to get a facelift. The TTD trust board has consented to spend Rs 14.5 crore for the renovation work.

Built in 1979, the 41-year-old building houses all the departments of the TTD, which manages the affairs of the Lord Venkateswara temple and over four dozen other temples across the country. Besides, it also houses the treasury and the Parakamani counting halls. The quadrangular building, with an open space at its heart, has three floors with a plinth area of 5,613 sq metres in each floor.

The renovations were warranted because, besides being in a severe need of repair, with the TTD administration migrating to the e-office system, a need has arisen to provide state-of-the-art workstations for its employees.

Taking all these factors into account, the TTD management, which first carried out a sample refurbishment work at one of its offices and followed it up by renovating the third floor of the administrative building, has now decided to refurbish the remaining two floors. As part of the approved works, TTD would be shelling out Rs 9.2 crore to complete various civil work, which includes new vitrified flooring, installing UPVC windows and renovation of toilets. Another Rs 4.3 crore will be spent for all electrical work, which includes purchase of split ACs, LED lights and wiring and Rs 1 crore will be spent to provide new work stations and modular furniture.

Title: Vadodara: Mother of five girls kills sixth daughter, held
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

VADODARA: A mother of six girls was arrested on Monday for killing one of her daughters who was born just two months back.

The accused Kalpana Parmar, who lives in Koyali village near the city, allegedly threw her infant daughter in a pond near her home on Sunday and then lodged a complaint of kidnapping at Jawaharnagar police station.

Kalpana, 35, and her husband Ramesh were blessed with a baby girl in November. But as the couple already had five daughters, Kalpana was not happy with the sixth girl child. During investigation police learnt that there was no harassment from her husband or anyone else, but she was personally not happy. In fact, her husband who is a casual labourer, was not even aware that Kalpana had killed their daughter.

On Sunday evening, Kalpana told Ramesh that the infant is missing from the bedroom where she had left her. The couple searched for her but when she was not found, Kalpana herself became the complainant. “During her statement we felt that she was hiding something as her facts were contradictory, so we questioned her alone during which she broke down and admitted to the crime,” said in-charge inspector B H Shingrakhiya of Jawaharnagar police station.

On Monday morning, firemen and police staff found the infant’s body from the pond. Police said that they removed the section of abduction from the FIR, added the murder section and arrested Kalpana.

Title: Ranji Trophy 2019-2020: Uttarakhand batsmen bundle out for paltry 109 runs
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: After being dismissed for a paltry score of 109 runs in the first innings, Uttarakhand pacers gave a strong reply in their Ranji Trophy cricket encounter against Haryana at the Rajiv Gandhi International Cricket Stadium in Dehradun on Monday. Uttarakhand won the toss and opted to bat first on an overcast morning. Uttarakhand batsmen continued with their poor outing as they were bundled out for 109 runs in their first innings. Uttarakhand had a poor start as both the openers went back to the pavilion without opening their account and by the time first 15 deliveries of the match were bowled Uttarakhand had lost their three wickets to Haryana’s pacers. The team’s innings never recovered and they got bowled out within 42 overs. Six batsmen got out for a single-digit score.

Uttarakhand’s new ball pair of Agrim Tiwari and Pradeep Chamoli, however, provided a dream start to their team as they dismissed four Haryana batsmen for a score of nine runs.

Title: Internal bickering in Cong: Dharchula MLA resigns from secy post
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: The differences in the opposition Congress, which have hogged limelight for the past few weeks, refuse to die down. A high-voltage drama ensued at the party’s state headquarters on Monday as Dharchula MLA Harish Dhami turned up to offer his resignation from the post of state secretary, which was recently given to him.

Dhami said that the post given to him was to “humiliate” him as his name was kept on the last slot in the list of 98 secretaries. Besides, he also accused leader of opposition Indira Hridayesh for not being named as a special invitee in the state committee. In the absence of Pritam SIngh at party office, Dhami gave his resignation to Dhasmana, who asked him to submit the document to the state chief. When asked over the issue, Pritam Singh said, “The change was made by the higher authorities and the state unit had no role. Dhami’s name is on 16th position in the list of special invitees. I will talk to the national leadership over the issue.”

Hridayesh said, “The list was forwarded to national headquarters and after consulting it with senior national members, our chief Sonia Gandhi gave a green signal to the list.”

Title: 2 bodies found in Doon
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: In two separate instances, a teenager and a man were found dead in Dehradun. While 17-year-old Abhishek Bisht was found hanging in a jungle area of Raipur, the skeletal remains of Gaurav Semwal, a resident of Mussoorie, were found in Vasant Vihar area.

In the first case, local residents spotted the teen hanging from a tree in Raipur and informed police. The body was retrieved and an identity card found on it helped police track down the deceased's family. Bisht was a class XI student at Government Inter College in Balawala area. No suicide note was recovered from the spot and police are still trying to find out the motive behind the teen taking the extreme step. Meanwhile, some clothes and a bank passbook recovered from the remains of a man in Vasant Vihar helped police identify him. An initial probe revealed that a missing case had been registered for Semwal at Kempty police station on December 13 last year. The probe was later shifted to Premnagar police station.

Title: CM likely to visit Sarada Peetham on February 3
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Chief Minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy is likely to visit the Port City on February 3, the last day of the annual celebrations of Visakha Sarada Peetham at Chinnamushidivada.

Sarada Peetham is organising a four-day annual programme which will be attended by the governors of Andhra Pradesh, Telangana and Tamil Nadu, Biswabhusan Harichandan, Tamilisai Soundararajan and Banwarilal Purohit, respectively. Meanwhile, TTD chairman YV Subba Reddy and Odisha governor Surjya Narayan Patro have confirmed their participation, sources said.

According to sources, not only chief ministers and governors, the Saradapeetham has invited a few national-level leaders, including Home Minister Amit Shah and MP Subramanian Swamy.

The Seer of Saradapeetham, Swamy Swaroopanandendra shares a good relationship with Telangana and Andhra Pradesh chief ministers as he performed Raja Syamala Yagam for both K Chandrashekar Rao and Jaganmohan Reddy before the elections. tnn

Title: Doon station likely to be operational from Feb 8
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: The renovation work of Dehradun railway station will be completed in the stipulated time and it will likely be opened for train movements in the second week of February. Train services to and from Dehradun railway station were halted on November 10 last year, and officials had promised that the renovation would be completed by February 7.

TOI sources say that the station has been remodelled in a way that showcases state’s heritage and traditions while keeping the British-era look intact as it was built during colonial times. Also, the length of all platforms between (PF-01) 390 metre and (PF-02) 630 metre have been increased so that an 18-coach train can easily halt at the station. Staircases and other passenger facilities have also been upgraded at the station.

Doon station director Ganesh Chand Thakur told TOI, “We have been monitoring the renovation work since it begun. We will finish the work within time. Senior railway officials have already inspected the ongoing renovation works at the station and are satisfied with its pace.”

Another railway official said, “The interiors of all offices in the station premises have also been renovated. Smart toilets with water booths have also been built on platforms.”

Title: NGO sends tur dal to CM Edappadi K Palaniswami , demands sacking of food minister
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

CM Edappadi K Palaniswami

CHENNAI: Arappor Iyakkam, a non-governmental organisation which filed a complaint demanding CBI probe into an alleged scam worth Rs 1,500 crore in the public distribution system recently, has launched a campaign demanding that chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami remove food minister R Kamaraj and suspend the officials involved in the scam.

The NGO has also sought ban on Christy Friedgram Industry Limited and related firms from participating in government tenders. “We have launched a campaign with our members sending tur dal, sugar and ‘zero-rupee notes’ to the chief minister in registered post to put pressure on him to act. We the citizens want the government to work for the people and ensure a transparent tender process,” said Arappor Iyakkam convenor Jayaram Venkatesan. The members of the anti-corruption movement are planning to meet the chief minister, chief secretary and finance secretary demanding action against the corrupt officials and political executives.

Responding to the allegations, Christy Friedgram Industry Limited managing director T S Kumarasamy told TOI that the firm has not violated any law. “They (government departments) float tenders and we participate in it. We get business as ours is the lowest tender. They (NGO) are at liberty to file a complaint. There is no substance in it (allegations). They (Arappor Iyakkam) could have done it with an ulterior motive. They could be instigated by the competitors,” he said. Kumarasamy, a major supplier of eggs in noon meal scheme, is already facing I-T probe for tax evasion.

Arappor Iyakkam had alleged that select firms related to Christy Friedgram and public-sector enterprises like State Trading Corporation, in collusion with Christy Friedgram, had quoted abnormally high rates ranging from Rs 10-30 per kg more than the prevailing market price for supplying various commodities like tur dal and sugar to the government.

An RTI reply confirmed that STC, the chosen bidder, had placed orders on Christy Friedgram for supply of palm oil at Rs 85.50 per litre in 2018. The market price of palm oil at that time was Rs 75.57 a litre and STC had taken tender at Rs 86.10 per litre.

Kumarasamy denied that tenders were tweaked by the government department to favour his firms. Food minister R Kamaraj told TOI that there was no truth in the allegations levelled by Arappor Iyakkam.

Title: Rera gets plaints against 100 builders
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Kerala real estate regulatory authority ( K-Rera ) will hold its first hearing on complaints against real estate projects on February 5. More than 100 complaints have been received by the authority from buyers of projects which have not received occupancy certificate.

While a good number of complaints pertain to delay in delivery, there are also complaints against builders for failing to deliver promised features regarding a project. Multiple complaints have been received against a single project itself and in other cases individual complaints have been received.

K-Rera has scheduled hearings in February for both the complainant and the respondent. Officials with K-Rera said complaints have been received against projects dating back to 2010, 2014 time-periods.

While the number of complaints against real estate builders and promoters have crossed 100, so far only 3 Rera registrations have been made under new projects. Although around 35 applications for new projects were received by the authority for registration, the process could not be completed due to erroneous filing of application or furnishing of inaccurate information. With the frequent recurrence of inaccuracies and irregularities, K-Rera has warned promoters that it will invoke Section 60 of Real Estate ( regulation and development) Act, 2016 which stipulates that any false information given or any contravention of provision of relevant sections by the promoter will attract a penalty which may extend up to 5% of the estimated cost of the real estate project.

The notice issued by K-Rera pointed out that in spite of several directions issued by the authority, many of the applications are not being filled in the prescribed manner and that it contains so much inaccuracies and irregularities. It was also found that some of the information sought in the application form were found omitted completely and some were found false and even altered from the mandated format.

In order to deal with growing number of flawed applications, K-Rera recently issued separate checklists for promoters of ongoing and new real estate projects. The promoters were directed to file duly filled checklist for filing application along with the application for registration.

The checklist includes a set of 27 requisite details like estimate of expenditure, nature of encumbrance, land records, plan of development works, audited balance sheet, description of land and the like. K-Rera chairman P H Kurien said the authority wants to make it very clear to the public that they shall not make bookings or purchase a real estate project which has not received registration from Rera.

Title: Korean lang programme in S’kulam IIIT
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: Srikakulam IIIT plan’s to introduce a specialised programme on Korean language with focus on automobile and networking. A delegation from Korea visited the institute recently to sign the MoU with III-S to impart the programme, said G Bhanu Kiran, director in-charge of the institute.

“As Korea is strong in networking and automobile engineering, they want skilled manpower from the state. Also, with the Kia manufacturing plant located in the state, the demand for students with Korean language skills has grown. The Korean institutes would send trained faculty. The programme would be helpful to all students at the institute, which now has a student strength of 4,000,” he said. tnn

Title: Producers demand Rs 1 crore from Shane; AMMA says ‘unfair’
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Kochi: Dispute between Kerala Flim Producers Association and actor Shane Nigam has worsened further with the latter reportedly demanding Rs 1 crore as compensation for settling the issue. However, Association of Malayalam Movie Artistes ( AMMA ) has opposed the demand by the producers citing it was against the reconciliation talks.

According to leaders of AMMA, the dispute has been settled through reconciliation talks with the producers. “It was after settling the issue that Shane Nigam dubbed for films which were pending following the row. The producers demand seeking Rs 1 crore compensation is unfair and so we can’t agree to it,” said Idavela Babu, general secretary, AMMA. The leadership of AMMA held a meeting in Kochi on Monday and decided to turn down the demand by producers. AMMA leadership also decided to take further steps according to the response from producers.

The dispute erupted after Shane Nigam allegedly misbehaved with producers, who later decided to impose a ban on him. They had also decided to scrap three of his films.

Later, AMMA intervened and settled the issues through reconciliation talks.

Title: State gets Centre’s in-principle approval of Rs 1,203 cr for water management project
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: The central government has given an in-principle approval of Rs 1,203 crore funds for Uttarakhand Water Management project. The project aims to rejuvenate water sources and create new lakes. Chief minister Trivendra Singh Rawat said on Monday that he has instructed officers of irrigation department to set a time frame for completion of each task under the project.

The irrigation department has sent an elaborate report on water management in the state and pre-feasibility report to the Centre for approval. Meanwhile, the Detailed Project Report (DPR) for proposed dams, canals and ponds is being made.

A presentation on the project was made before the chief minister on Monday. The CM also directed officials to ensure that planning and execution of the project is done in timeas it would immensely benefit the state in the long run.

State secretary of irrigation Bhupinder Kaur Aulakh said that the ambitious project would increase irrigation capacity and automatically boost agricultural growth. Aulakh added that it would also recharge ground water. A budget of Rs 90 crore has been kept for mapping of water sources and spring shed management, Rs 324 crore for gravity-based irrigation schemes, Rs 176 crore for desilting of water bodies and Rs 613 crore for construction of 10 dams and lakes.

Title: JNU asks Sharjeel Imam to appear before panel on February 3
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Sharjeel Imam (File photo)

NEW DELHI: Even as police of different states have launched a manhunt for JNU student Sharjeel Imam , the varsity administration has directed him to report before the proctorial committee before February 3. The inquiry against him is based on alleged “provocative speeches” made by him at Aligarh Muslim University .

Meanwhile, student groups of JNU and Jamia Millia on Monday came out in support of Imam, demanding revocation of all cases against him.

JNU registrar Pramod Kumar in a statement said, “A security report dated January 27 against Sharjeel Imam, a PhD student at Centre for Historical Studies, School of Social Sciences, has been received in the chief proctor’s office from the office of the chief security officer. The report cites media reports that on January 16, Imam made provocative speeches at AMU threatening the unity, integrity and sovereignty of the country upheld by the Constitution.”

However, the notice doesn’t mention under which section of the university ordinance has the student been summoned as the incident took place outside the JNU campus.

Jamia students held a march outside the central canteen on Monday and alleged that Imam was targeted for his identity. They objected to the sedition case against him.

Arshad, a management student, said, “The video being circulated has been misconstrued by many. He didn’t say that we should divide Northeast from India, but that there should be a Shaheen Bagh-like road blockade. Imam has always advocated chakka jam as a means to put pressure on the government. He only wanted a chakka jam, something that several political outfits have indulged in the past.”

At JNU, two councillors, Afreen Fatima and Farhat Salim, and organisations like Assam Study Circle, Bahujan Sahitya Sangh, BAPSA, Democratic Students Union, Northeast Students’ Forum and others, came out in solidarity with Imam.

“We stand in firm solidarity with Sharjeel Imam and demand the revocation of all cases against him immediately. We condemn in the strongest terms the Islamophobia of media and police against the anti-CAA protesters,” said their joint statement.

Title: Six-laning of bypass highway likely by 2021
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: If everything goes according to plan, the widening (six-laning) of the 51-km-long Anandapuram-Anakapalle road—via Pendurthi and Sabbavaram—is likely to be completed by July 2021.

The expansion of the Anandapuram-Anakapalle section into six lanes has picked up pace. So far, however, only 18 km of the stretch has been completed. The project is being executed by Madhya Pradesh-based Dilip Buildcon Limited under the Bharatmala Pariyojana scheme.

Speaking to TOI, P Shiva Shankar, the project director of NHAI’s Vizag unit, said that 330 hectares—including 190 hectares of private land—was required for the project. “Due to some technical issues, such as identifying genuine owners of private land in some areas, there was a delay in acquiring land in around 7.2 km of the stretch. The process of land acquisition and issue of compensation will be completed in a couple of months,” said Shiva Shankar.

“We are hoping that the project will be completed before the deadline (July 2021), as the government wants to complete the project as early as possible,” Shiva Shankar added.

A senior police officer with the traffic wing said that the six-laning of the Anandapuram-Anakapalle stretch of the highway will be a boon for commuters in Vizag as the project will clear at least 40 per cent of the traffic congestion on the highway stretch within Vizag city limits.

Once the project is complete, heavy vehicles plying on Srikakulam road to Vijayawada route will be diverted at Anandapuram to reach Anakapalle without passing through Vizag city.

Similarly, vehicles heading towards Srikakulam from Vijayawada can be diverted from Anakapalle to Anandapuram where the original Chennai-Kolkata highway connects.

The widening of the Anandapuram-Pendurthi-Anakapalle corridor and the 13.6-km stretch between Sabbavaram and Sheelanagar port connectivity has been sanctioned by the Union government for Rs 3,000 crore, including a compensation amount of Rs 700 crore for those who gave up land for the project.

Title: Two from Vadodara stuck in Wuhan
Content:
Anxious parents of Shreya Jaiman

VADODARA: Two students from Vadodara are stuck along with other students of India in China’s Wuhan city.Shreya Jaiman and Vrund Patel, who are second year students of MBBS in Hubei University in Wuhan city, are stuck inside their hostel room on the university campus in Wuhan which has been quarantined with all routes in and out of the city closed or highly regulated due to the outbreak of Wuhan corona virus.The parents of Shreya and Vrund have appealed to Prime Minister Narendra Modi, union home minister Amit Shah to intervene and ensure that the kids return to India safely.“The students are not infected by the virus. But their condition is very bad. They are all put inside the rooms of their hostel campus with not much to eat or drink,” said 18-year-old Shreya’s father Shashi Jaiman, who works with Indian Railways.The girl’s father on Monday sent out desperate appeals to the PMO, home minister’s office apart from Gujarat chief minister Vijay Rupani through twitter.Vrund’s father Ramesh Patel told TOI that the students, who were wearing masks, were all put up inside their rooms and had to walk one and a half km just to fetch water.“Since the last two days, markets have been closed. Even getting proper drinking water has become difficult. Presently, they are surviving on whatever stock they have with them,” said Patel, who works as a primary school teacher at Jesingpura primary school in Tilakwada taluka of Narmada district “The students are cooking on the scarce food stock and having food only once during the day,” said Patel.According to the parents, all other countries are ensuring that students in Wuhan safely return to their homes. “We are also appealing to our government to intervene and ensure the safe return of our wards,” said Patel.The parents had a telephonic conversation with Vadodara MP Ranjan Bhatt who assured them of all the support from her office.

Title: US Nagar cop held by vigilance team for taking bribe
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Rudrapur: A constable of Jhankaiya police station has been caught red-handed taking bribe from a complainant. A team from the vigilance unit of Haldwani (Nainital) laid a trap for constable Kushal Kanyal after they were informed that the cop had been asking for a bribe of Rs 20,000 to settle a case.

Senior vigilance officers said that they had received a complaint from Daya Shankar Prajapati of Jhankaiya about the constable demanding bribe from him to settle a family property dispute.

Kanyal was caught in the act and booked under the Prevention of Corruption Act.

A probe has been initiated to find out if any other officer from the police station was also involved in taking a portion of the bribe. “Kanyal is being questioned,” said SP vigilance Amit Srivastava.

Title: Delhi HC rejects plea against free bus ride notification
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

NEW DELHI: Delhi high court on Monday refused to set aside an AAP government notification permitting free travel for women in Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) buses, only on the ground that it did not cover cluster buses.

The court said if free travel for women was being also enforced in cluster buses running in the city without a notification then such action would be “bad” but could not be termed illegal.

A bench of Chief Justice D N Patel and Justice C Hari Shankar declined to entertain a plea challenging the notification providing free travel for women on buses operated by DTC in Delhi.

“The notification does not say the scheme is applicable on cluster buses. We cannot believe it on your statement. It does not talk of cluster buses. If Delhi government has made it applicable on cluster buses, then the notification is not bad, their action is....you challenge that before a single judge. File a better petition,” the court told the petitioner.

In the plea, the petitioner, which claims to represent public transport operators, including mini buses, grameen sewa, and rural transport vehicles, had assailed the notification on this ground. But sensing the bench was not inclined to grant relief, the lawyer for the petitioner sought permission to withdraw the plea and was allowed to do so.

Title: Infra dvpt: 41 schools get new buildings, 50 more in final stage
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: Infrastructure upgradation of schools , as part of public education rejuvenation mission, has been completed in 41 schools.

New buildings were set up in 25 schools under Rs 5 crore category in each Assembly constituency and 16 schools in the Rs 3 crore category, Kerala Infrastructure and Technology for Education, which is the nodal agency for the work said. Further, the construction activities in 50 schools (30 schools in Rs 5 crore category and 20 schools in Rs 3 crore category) is in the final stage.

The higher number of school infrastructure development works were completed in Kozhikode district. Work on nine schools have been completed there. Work on seven schools each were over in other districts, except Idukki, Pathanamthitta and Alappuzha where construction activities commenced lately.

The contract assigned to one Sree Shyalam Contracting company has been terminated owing to failure in timely completion of works in four schools in Thrissur district viz GHSS Mullassery, GVHSS Puthoor, GKVHSS Eriyaad and GMHSS Nadavaramba at their risk and cost. On a similar note, the process for terminating the contract with Seguro Foundations assigned with the works of GHSS Peruvallur in Malappuram district is also in the final stage. New contractors will be identified in such locations soon.

“KITE has initiated necessary steps to ensure that the construction activities of 141 schools are completed and handed over before the start of the next academic year”, said K Anvar Sadath, CEO, KITE.

Title: Anti-CAA protesters in Haldwani sing Faiz, say they will continue stir
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Nainital: The protesters in Haldwani area of Nainital sang poems of poets such as Faiz Ahmed Faiz, Sahir Ludhianvi and Pash to protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) as well as proposed National Register of Citizens (NRC) and National Population Register (NPR).

The 72-hour-long protest which entered its third day on Monday has seen active participation from the local residents, including several women and children from the locality making people draw comparisons to Delhi’s Shaheen Bagh protest.

The organisers said that they sang the poems of revolutionary poets such as Faiz and Habib Jalib because they are a symbol of resistance for people. “These poets braved the tyranny of the dictators and resisted the divisive nature of their policies. It is important that people participating in the protests today should be aware of these poets and their works,” said Kailash Pandey, one of the organisers of the protest. Raja Bahuguna, another protester, said, “This 72-hour-long protest in Haldwani is a testament to the fact that all sections of society are against the divisive policies of the government. The women have come out in large numbers and they are sleeping at the protest site.”

When asked about the future course of action of the protest, Pandey said that they will convene a meeting on Tuesday. “Though the three-day protest will end on Tuesday, but we have decided that our protest will not die. We will decide the future course of action in a meeting but our decision to protest the dictatorial steps won’t end,” he said.

Several cities in the hill state, including Dehradun, Nainital, Kashipur and Rudrapur have seen massive protests against CAA and NRC since the Act was passed by both houses of Parliament last year.

Title: Environment not forgotten in Vizag couple’s wedding
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: In an unusual pre-wedding ‘ceremony’, former city resident Krishna Chaitanya and his fiancé Yasmin Bhattacharya, will engage in environmentally-friendly activities on the day before their wedding.

The couple are getting married in Chaitanya’s hometown on February 5. Instead of holding celebrations with family and friends before the wedding, the two have decided to conduct a nature walk, an awareness programme and clean-up activities at the geo-heritage site of Erra Matti Dibbalu and at Rushikonda Beach on February 4.

The 31-year-olds, both faculty at universities in Japan, have sought the support of local green organisations and the tourism department for their eco-activity. Around 25 of their colleages from Japan and friends will be part of the clean-up drive.

The couple is collaborating with organisations such as Greenface Environment Society, Citizens Association for Responsible Tourism (Cart), Sampdure and Rookie Rider to gather volunteers for the awareness and clean-up drive.

Speaking to TOI, Chaitanya said, “Both of us work in the field of disaster management and are aware of environmental issues . Theoretical contribution is not enough for sustainable solutions. Keeping our earth clean and liveable is a collective responsibility of everyone, irrespective of any nationality. Since marriage is an event of large gatherings with lots of friends and relatives visiting us, we decided to use this as an opportunity to do our bit for nature, environment and society and generate awareness on clean and safe beaches.”

Title: Ugandan woman sent to eight-day police custody
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Representative image

Calangute: Ugandan national Minamu Hafusa, 22, arrested on Saturday in connection with the alleged murder of Aldona resident Zeferino Barretto, was remanded in eight-day police custody by the Mapusa judicial magisterate first class (JMFC).

Barretto, 45, was found dead at Saunta Vaddo in Calangute , on Friday morning.

This is the second time Hafusa has been arrested. In March last year she was picked up at Ximer in Candolim after she was found without any travel documents.

A Tanzanian woman, Elizabeth Magusi, who was with her, had also been arrested.

Title: Proposed licence fee deferred after traders meet mayor
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: In a relief to the business community of the city, mayor Sunil Uniyal Gama on Monday withdrew the proposal to levy licence fee on over 100 different types of businesses. The licence fee had been in the pipeline in order to raise more revenue for the Dehradun Municipal Corporation (DMC). Soon after it was proposed, the traders ’ association had gone on the warpath regarding the move. On Monday, they also held a protest at the DMC office but after a lengthy discussion with the mayor, it was decided that the proposed bill will be withdrawn for the time being.

Mayor Sunil Uniyal Gama told TOI, “After having discussions with the representatives of various trade unions, we have decided to postpone the proposed licencing scheme. As of now, we won’t implement it in the upcoming financial year.”

The traders expressed happiness at the mayor’s statement.

“We told the mayor that the trading community is already paying house tax to the DMC. Imposing a hefty licence fee would add considerably to our financial burden. We are thankful that he listened to us patiently and decided to withdraw the proposal,” said Sunil Masson, general secretary of Doon Udyog Vyapar Mandal.

Vipin Nagalia, president of the vyapar mandal, added, “Presently, the country is facing an economic slowdown due to which there is a fall in the revenue of traders. Imposing an additional cess in such a scenario is not justified at all.”

To recall, the DMC had mooted the proposal regarding imposing a licence fee on more than 100 different kinds of businesses in the city on January 19. Currently, only nine different kinds of businesses are required to pay licence fee to the corporation.

Title: JNU prof claims dean promoted unlawfully
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

New Delhi: A professor of JNU ’s School of Computer & Systems Sciences (SC&SS) in a letter to the chancellor has alleged that vice-chancellor M Jagadesh Kumar broke rules by unlawfully promoting the current head of the department. Through an RTI application, Rajeev Kumar found that the current HOD had two backdated promotions, which were not permitted by UGC.

Kumar alleged that SC&SS dean TV Vijay Kumar was given three promotions — from assistant professor to professor — within a year.

While the chancellor was not available for comment, a member of SC&SS, on the condition of anonymity, said, “Vijay Kumar has completed 13 years of service. He had become associate professor through the career advancement scheme in 2016. He then applied for professorship in 2017 through open interviews. There is no issue in his promotions.” TNN

Title: Leopard mauls 55-yr-old man to death in Kotdwar
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Dehradun: A 55-year-old man was mauled to death by a leopard on Saturday night. His body was discovered by a group of women who had gone to collect fodder in the forest on January 26 morning.

The leopard had attacked Praveen Singh near Angali village in Ranikhet. The villagers said they are afraid and demanded that the leopard be declared a man eater.

The range officer of Pokhra, Rakhi Juyal said that cages had been set up in sensitive areas of the locality.

Title: Cops get expert help to stay tech-savvy, beat conmen
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Visakhapatnam: In order to keep abreast with latest developments in technology, police in the state are taking the help of experts of different social media platforms and digital applications.

Police officials stated as more and more fraudsters use technology to dupe victims, police are often left in the lurch when it comes to identfying and understanding the tools used in the crime. The delay allows fraudsters to get away with their crime.

“While investigating cases we have seen that the fraudsters are using recent technologies while committing the crime. By the time we are able to understand the technology, precious time has been lost. The need of the hour is to stay abreast with latest technologies,” said a senior police official.

Officials in the cybercrime wing have taken part in two seminars in the city in the last five months where experts from social media platforms and digital app companies were present to help the police get accustomed to the latest developments in technology.

At least 50 cybercrimes are reported in the state every day on average, across different cybercrime police stations across the state. Most of these crimes originate on a social media site, with a fraudster posting an advertisement, and ends on an online application in which an unsuspecting victim sends money to the fraudster in exchange for a product or service.

An investigating officer has to first understand how a social media site works, said an official, followed by sound knowledge of the technology behind different payment applications so that time is not wasted during the course of the investigation.

“While investigating the case they should only try to find out from where and how the crime originated and then zero-in on the accused. Even if we cannot nab the accused, we can recover the stolen amount and return it to the victim,” the official added.

Besides staying updated on technology, the police has also launched awareness initiatives for users of social media sites and online applications through displaying slides at film theatres, circulating pamphlets and booklets, conducting workshops in schools and colleges, requesting bank official to alert customers through SMS and by hosting radio programmes.

Title: Contractors boycott tenders over pending dues
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Thiruvananthapuram: To protest against the stalemate in the construction sector, All Kerala Government Contractors’ Association and the Kerala government contractors’ joint action council are planning strikes in the coming days. A joint council of government contractors is planning an indefinite strike in front of the Secretariat from March 4.

AKGCA and the Kerala government contractors’ joint action council conducted separate press meets to announce the strike.

AKGCA, during a press meet on Thursday, said they decided to boycott all the tenders of government departments from January 20 over the delay in releasing pending arrears worth around Rs 4,000 crore. The association has started boycotting tender of public works department, local self-government department and irrigation department.

They said the government owed the contractors Rs 4,000 crore and was harassing them with new rules. “The local self government has to release dues worth Rs 1,300 crore for the past eight months. While PWD owed Rs 2,200 crore, other departments owed Rs 500 crore,” AKGCA members said.The joint action council asked the government to revise the bill discount project so that banks release funds after accepting invoice acceptance statement. “The government can pay back the money with interest based on its financial condition,” said Varghese Kannampally, president of Kerala government contractors’ association. New orders are brought to increase the burden of contractors. The government is now demanding capability certificates of the contractors from banks, and they are made compulsory to renew the licence that costs around Rs 50,000. The defect liability period has been raised to five years. The incentive for completing work on time has been stopped. The government has denied GST of 2017-18, 18-19 to contractors, and they are getting notices to pay service tax, the contractors alleged.

The joiny action council said that they are organizing a mass meeting at Thiruvananthapuram on February 3 to explain about the crisis in the state’s construction sector wherein experts in various areas and socio-political leaders will be present. From March 4 onwards, members from Kerala government contractors’ association, electrical contractors association, LSDG contractors association and PMGSY contractors association will take part in a relay fast. From April 13, the protesters will gherao the collectorate and Secretariat.

Title: Assessors begin inspection for Swachh Survekshan 2020
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Trichy: A group of on-field assessors deputed by the Union ministry of housing and urban affairs (MoHUA) inspected all the four zones of Trichy corporation on Monday as part of the Swachh Survekshan 2020, a pan-India cleanliness ranking. The three-day-long direct observation by the assessors will play a crucial role in deciding the rank of Trichy in the national cleanliness survey.

The four-member team visited Srirangam, Ponmalai, Ariyamangalam and K Abishekapuram zones. Residential and commercial localities such as Chithirai streets, Sangliyandapuram, Rockins Road, Collector Office Road and Duraisamipuram were inspected by the team.

“The assessors visited places including transport hubs, markets. They updated their inference online,” an official source with the corporation said. To ensure transparency, another team from the Union ministry monitored the assessment team.

The assessment team will validate the claims of the civic body in public hygiene as mentioned in the documents submitted to the Swachh Bharat Mission. Claims of periodical maintenance of public toilets and night sweeping activities in commercial streets will be randomly checked. If any false claims are found, negative marks will be awarded. \

The assessment is likely to conclude on Wednesday. Sources said that a separate team from New Delhi had completed analysis on the city’s open defecation free (ODF) status in the last two days. Of the total 6,000 marks in the survey, 1,500 are earmarked for direct observation which is underway. Similarly, 1,500 are allotted for the certification category which analysed the ODF status.

Title: Formation of vending panel an uphill task for corporation
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Trichy: Constituting the vending committee to streamline the operations of street vendors in a manner not affecting public mobility continues to be an uphill task for the Trichy City Corporation. Lack of cohesive efforts from the stakeholders to sensitize, persuade and relocate street vendors are said to be the reasons for the failure to find a solution.

Soon after the state government amended the Tamil Nadu Street Vendors (Protection of Livelihood and Regulation of Street Vending) Scheme 2015, Trichy City Corporation should have constituted the vending committee. The committee comprising the representatives of street vendors, local body officials, city police personnel and NGOs will earmark space for street vendors to set up stalls in a manner not disturbing the vehicular traffic. After much delay, the civic body initiated the process to constitute the committee in August 2019. Subsequently, the corporation enumerated the street vendors and issued ID cards to a few. But the efforts faced a major setback with a section of street vendors approaching Madras high court alleging that the enumeration process was incomplete, and obtained a stay order against conducting the election to form the vending committee. The committee will have 15 members from various departments including six members who are directly elected by street vendors as their representatives.

“We have been trying to meet corporation commissioner to appraise the need of constituting a vending committee in vain. Joint discussion is the need of the hour,” K Suresh, a CPI functionary, said. Among the 4,000 street vendors surveyed by the civic body, around 2,000 were given ID cards. Those who did not receive ID cards were in the perception that they cannot vote in the election. However, corporation officials clarified that having their names in the survey is adequate for the street vendors to vote. The clarification, however, has failed to appease the street vendors.

Earlier, Deepavali and Pongal festivals were stated as excuses to hold discussions with the street vendors’ union for vacating the stay order. Trade unions blamed the civic body for not convening a meeting of all the unions of street vendors to find an amicable solution to conduct the election. “Soon we will conduct a meeting of street vendors to lift the stay order amicably and form the vending committee,” a civic body official said.

Title: Sarpanch, panchs’ posts to remain vacant in Jaipur
Content:
This story is from January 28, 2020

Jaipur: As the third phase of panchayat polls to 83 gram panchayats under three panchayat samitis - Jhotwara, Viratnagar and Pawta - in Jaipur district is going to be held on January 29, polls to the post of a sarpanch and 13 ward panchs in Pawta will not be held due to non-receipt of any nomination.

District Collector Joga Ram said that due to non-receipt of any nomination for the post of sarpanch and ward panches, from ward number 1 to 11, at Bhonawas gram panchayat in Pawta, the posts will remain vacant.

"Also, due to non-receipt of any nomination for the post of ward panch in ward 6 of Badnagar gram panchayat Badnagar and the only nomination received in ward No 3 of Sundarpura Dhadha, the posts of panches in these wards will remain vacant. Thus, in the Pawta panchayat samiti, the posts of 13 ward panches will remain vacant. We have informed this to the state election commission as well," said the collector.

The sarpanch and ward panch (from ward number 1 to 5) at Kishanpura gram panchayat of Viratnagar panchayat samiti have been declared unopposed.

Title: Padma for Adnan Sami triggers Congress-BJP war of words
Content: NEW DELHI: A political scrap broke out over the award of Padma Shri to Adnan Sami , with BJP taking on Congress after the opposition party criticised the selection, saying Sami was the son of a Pakistan airforce pilot, by claiming Sonia Gandhi ’s family’s alleged praise for Mussolini.BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra on Monday asked Congress to explain if the opposition party will raise doubts over citizenship to Sonia Gandhi as “her father was part of the fascist Armed forces”. BJP ally Ram Vilas Paswan said the criticism was ill-informed and betrayed a lack of knowledge of Indian citizenship laws.Congress had hit out at the Modi government for bestowing Padma Shri on Sami and asked Mohmmad Sannaullah, whom it described as Kargil veteran, was declared a foreigner through the NRC exercise in Assam, while the son of a PAF pilot was conferred with one of India's highest civilian honours. There were differences among Congress leaders as Digvijay Singh had welcomed the government decision.The award to the well-known singer and composer saw NCP and Raj Thackeray’s MNS join the criticism as he was not an “original Indian citizen”. The singer and Congress spokesperson Jaiveer Shergill engaged in a long spat on Twitter, with Sami saying he was not disowning his father but did not hesitate to acknowledge his new country. Shergill, addressing Sami derogatively as “uncle”, asked the singer outline his contributions.Paswan said the singer was granted Indian citizenship in 2016 and has “elevated India’s repute and honour through his talent”. Patra alleged that Sonia Gandhi’s father was “associated” with the regimes of Italian dictator Mussolini and Germany’s Hitler. “If Adnan Sami’s father’s background is held against him by some ‘liberals’ and opposition parties for criticising the Padma award to him, then the Congress should answer as to why (Sonia) Gandhi was given Indian citizenship,” he said.
